1988 codification   class b wine permits a class b wine permit authorizes the holder to purchase wine from a person holding a class a wine permit and sell wine in original containers only at retail to consumers for consumption off the premises added during 1988 codification   applicationcontentsbond required a verified application for the original issuance or the renewal of a liquor control license wine permit or a beer permit shall be filed at such time in such number of copies and in such form as the state administrator of the alcoholic beverages division shall prescribe on forms prescribed by him or her the application shall be accompanied by the required fee and bond and be filed with the city council for approval or disapproval the bond to be submitted shall be in a form prescribed by the state administrator and in the amount set by state statute or administrative rules added during 1988 codification   license or permitfees fees shall be submitted with the respective application as set by state statute or administrative rules added during 1988 codification   prohibited interest it is unlawful for any person or persons to be either directly or indirectly interested in both retail and wholesale permits or licenses except as specifically allowed by state laws added during 1988 codification   separate locationsclassifications requiring separate permit every person holding a class b beer or class c beer permit or class b wine permit having more than one place of business where beer or wine is sold is required to have a separate license for each separate place of business except as otherwise provided by state law added during 1988 codification   license or permitinvestigation of applicant upon receipt of an original application for a liquor license wine permit or beer permit by the city council it shall be forwarded to the chief of police who shall conduct an investigation and shall submit a written report on the moral fitness of the applicant and as to the truth of the facts declared in the application and a recommendation to the city council as to the approval of the license or permit it shall be the duty of the fire chief to inspect the premises to determine if they conform to the requirements of the city no license or permit shall be approved until or unless an approving report has been filed with the city council by such officers added during 1988 codification   renewal procedures upon receipt of an application for the renewal of a liquor license wine permit or beer permit it shall be forwarded to the chief of police only who shall conduct an investigation and shall submit a written report on the applicant as to the truth of the facts declared in the application and a recommendation to the city council as to the approval of the license or permit added during 1988 codification   liability insurance required every liquor control licensee and class b beer permittee shall furnish proof of financial responsibility by the existence of a liability insurance policy in such amount as determined by the state alcoholic beverages division this applies to any licensee or permittee who sells liquor wine or beer for consumption on the premises and to class e liquor control licensees added during 1988 codification   license or permittransferability a license is a purely personal privilege and may be suspended or revoked for cause it shall not constitute property or be subject to attachment and execution nor be transferable by gift sale or bequest nor assignable and in any case it shall cease upon the death of the permittee or licensee however the administrator of the alcoholic beverages division may in his or her discretion allow the executor or administrator of a permittee or licensee to operate the business of the decedent for a reasonable time not to exceed the expiration date of the permit or license every permit or license shall be issued in the name of the true owner and no person holding the permit or license shall allow any other person to use it added during 1988 codification   license or permitcouncil action and approval the city council shall approve or disapprove the application action taken by the city council shall be endorsed on the application the application fee penal bond and certificate of dram shop liability insurance if applicable shall be forwarded to the iowa alcoholic beverages division for further action as provided by law added during 1988 codification   license or permitterm a liquor control licenses wine permits and beer permits unless sooner suspended or revoked expire one year from date of issuance the state administrator will give sixty days written notice of the expiration to each licensee or permittee b the administrator of alcoholic beverages may issue sixmonth or eightmonth seasonal liquor control licenses class b wine permits or class b beer permits for a proportionate part of the annual license or permit fee no seasonal license or permit shall be renewed at its expiration except after a period of two months c the administrator may issue fourteenday class a class b and class c liquor control licenses fourteenday class b wine permits and fourteenday class b beer permits a fourteenday license or permit if granted is valid for fourteen consecutive days but the holder shall not sell on the two sundays in the fourteenday period unless the holder qualifies for and obtains the privilege to sell on sundays in accordance with state law the fee for a fourteenday liquor license wine permit or beer permit is onequarter of the annual fee for that class of liquor license wine or beer permit the fee for the privilege to sell on the two sundays in the fourteenday period is twenty percent of the price of the fourteenday liquor license wine permit or beer permit d no refund shall be made for seasonal licenses or permits or for fourteenday liquor licenses wine permits or beer permits added during 1988 codification   license or permitrefunds any licensee or permittee or his or her executor administrator or any person duly appointed by the court to take charge of and administer the property or assets of the licensee or permittee for the benefit of his or her creditors may voluntarily surrender the license or permit to the state alcoholic beverages division and shall notify the city and the division of the city or the city by itself in the case of a retail beer permit shall refund to the person so surrendering the license or permit a proportionate amount of the fee paid for such license or permit as follows if surrendered during the first three months of the period for which such license or permit was issued the refund shall be threefourths of the amount of the fee  if surrendered more than three months but not more than six months after issuance the refund shall be onehalf of the amount of the fee  if surrendered more than six months but not more than nine months after issuance the refund shall be onefourth of the amount of the fee no refund shall be made however for a liquor control license or beer permit surrendered more than nine months after issuance no refund shall be made to any licensee or permittee upon the surrender of the license or permit if there is at the time of the surrender a complaint filed with the state division or the city charging the licensee or permittee with a violation of this chapter or provisions of the iowa alcoholic beverage control act if upon hearing on the complaint the license or permit is not revoked or suspended then the licensee or permittee shall be eligible upon surrender of the license or permit to receive a refund but if the license or permit has been revoked or suspended upon hearing the person shall not be eligible for the refund of any portion of the license or permit fee no refund shall be made for seasonal or fourteenday licenses or permits added during 1988 codification   transfers to other locations the council will in its discretion authorize a licensee or permittee to transfer the license or permit from one location to another within the city  provided that the premises to which the transfer is to be made would have been eligible for a license or permit in the first instance and the transfer will not result in the violation of any law or ordinance an applicant for a transfer shall file with the application for transfer proof of dram shop liability insurance and penal bond covering the premises to which the license is to be transferred added during 1988 codification   prohibited sales and acts no person or club holding a liquor control license or retail wine or beer permit or their agents or employees shall do any of the following a sell dispense or give to any intoxicated person or one simulating intoxication any alcoholic liquor wine or beer  b sell or dispense any alcoholic beverage beer or wine on the premises covered by the license or permit or permit its consumption thereon between the hours of two am and six am on a weekday and between the hours of two am on sunday and six am on the following monday however a holder of a liquor control license retail beer permit or wine permit authorized to sell alcoholic liquor beer or wine on sunday may sell or dispense those items between the hours of eight am on sunday and two am on the following monday  c sell alcoholic liquor wine or beer to any person on credit except with a bona fide credit card this provision shall not apply to sales by a club to its members nor to sales by a hotel or motel to bona fide registered guests  d employ any person under the age of eighteen years old in the sale or serving of alcoholic liquor wine or beer for consumption on the premises where sold  e sell give or otherwise supply any alcoholic liquor wine or beer to any person knowing or having reasonable cause to believe the person to be under legal age or permit any person knowing or having reasonable cause to believe the person to be under legal age to consume any alcoholic beverage wine or beer  f in the case of a retail beer or wine permittee knowingly allow the mixing or adding of alcohol or any alcoholic beverage to beer wine or any other beverage in or about the licensees or permittees place of business  g knowingly permit any gambling gaming solicitations for immoral purposes or immoral or disorderly conduct on the premises covered by the license or permit except games of chance permitted by state law added during 1988 codification  3192012   advertising signs prohibited no signs or other matter advertising any brand of alcoholic liquor beer or wine shall be erected or placed upon the outside of any premises occupied by a licensee or permittee authorized to sell alcoholic liquor beer or wine at retail all signs formerly erected shall be removed by the owner of the premises added during 1988 codification   suspension and revocation following written notice and hearing a liquor license wine permit or beer permit may be suspended for a period up to one year for violations of this chapter or revoked for any of the following causes a misrepresentation of any material fact in the application for the license or permit  b violation of any of the provisions of the iowa alcoholic beverages control act  c any change in the ownership or interest in the business operated under a class a class b or class c liquor control license or any beer or wine or combined permit which change was not previously reported to and approved by the city and the state alcoholic beverages division  d an event which would have resulted in disqualification from receiving the license or permit when originally issued  e any sale hypothecation or transfer of the license or permit  f the failure or refusal on the part of a licensee or permittee to render any report or remit any taxes to the state alcoholic beverages division under the state act added during 1988 codification   effect of revocation any liquor control license or wine or beer permittee whose license or permit is revoked under the iowa alcoholic beverage control act shall not be permitted to hold a liquor control license wine or beer permit in the state for a period of two years from the date of revocation the spouse and business associates holding ten percent or more of the capital stock or ownership interest in the business of a person whose license or permit has been revoked shall not be issued a liquor control license or beer permit and no liquor control license or wine or beer permit shall be issued which covers any business in which the person has a financial interest for a period of two years from the date of such revocation in the event a license or permit is revoked the premises which have been covered by such license or permit shall not be relicensed for one year added during 1988 codification   revocation or suspensionhearing the council shall conduct its hearing on suspension or revocation in the following manner a the licensee or permit holder and the surety on the licensees or permittees bond shall be served with written notice containing a copy of the complaint against the licensee or permittee the chapter provisions or state statutes allegedly violated and the date time and place for a hearing on the matter  b the council shall conduct a hearing at which both the licensee or permit holder and the complainants shall be present the purpose of which is to determine the truth of the facts alleged on the complaint should the licensee or permit holder or their authorized representative fail to appear without good cause the council may proceed to a determination on the merits of the complaint  c the licensee or permit holder shall have the right to be represented by counsel to testify and present witnesses in his or her own behalf and to crossexamine adverse witnesses  d the council shall admit only reliable and substantial evidence into the revocation or suspension proceeding and shall give all admitted evidence its natural probative value  e in the event that criminal charges have been brought against the licensee or permit holder on the same facts and circumstances as are the basis for the revocation or suspension complaint the council shall await a judgment in the criminal action before conducting the revocation or temporary suspension hearing required by this section neither a conviction nor an acquittal in the criminal action shall be conclusive for purposes of the revocation or suspension proceeding held under this section  f the council shall make and record findings of fact and conclusions of law and shall revoke or suspend a license or permit under this section only when upon review of the entire record it finds evidence of a substantial violation of this chapter or state law added during 1988 codification   appeal and hearingstate statutes adopted iowa subsections 123324 and 5 are adopted by reference added during 1988 codification   consumption in public placesintoxication it is unlawful for any person to use or consume alcoholic liquors wine or beer upon the public streets or highways or alcoholic liquors in any public place except premises covered by a liquor control license or to possess or consume alcoholic liquors wine or beer on any public school property or while attending any public or private school related functions and no person shall be intoxicated nor simulate intoxication in a public place as used in this section school means a school or that portion thereof which provides teaching for any grade from kindergarten twelve any person violating any provisions of this section shall be fined not to exceed one hundred dollars or sentenced not to exceed thirty days imprisonment added during 1988 codification   open containers in motor vehiclesdrivers a driver of a motor vehicle upon a public street or highway shall not possess in the passenger area of the motor vehicle an open or unsealed bottle can jar or other receptacle containing an alcoholic beverage passenger area means the area designed to seat the driver and passengers while the motor vehicle is in operation and any area that is readily accessible to the driver or a passenger while in their seating positions including the glove compartment an open or unsealed receptacle containing an alcoholic beverage may be transported behind the last upright seat of the motor vehicle if the motor vehicle does not have a trunk a person convicted of a violation of this section is guilty of a simple misdemeanor punishable as a scheduled violation under iowa 8 subsection 10 paragraph b  2002 added during 1988 codification   open containers in motor vehiclespassengers a a passenger in a motor vehicle upon a public street or highway shall not possess in the passenger area of the motor vehicle an opened or unsealed bottle can jar or other receptacle containing an alcoholic beverage passenger area means the area of a motor vehicle designed to seat the driver and passengers while the motor vehicle is in operation and any area that is readily accessible to the driver or a passenger while in their seating positions including the glove compartment an open or unsealed receptacle containing an alcoholic beverage may be transported in the trunk of the motor vehicle an unsealed receptacle containing an alcoholic beverage may be transported behind the last upright seat of the motor vehicle if the motor vehicle does not have a trunk b this section does not apply to a passenger being transported in a motor vehicle designed maintained or used primarily for the transportation of persons for compensation or a passenger being transported in the living quarters of a motor home mobile home travel trailer or fifthwheel trailer c a person convicted of a violation of this section is guilty of a simple misdemeanor punishable as a scheduled violation under iowa 8 subsection 10 paragraph b d in accordance with iowa a4 a conviction for a violation of this section shall not be included on the individual driving record of the person committing the violation and the conviction shall not be considered by the department of transportation in any proceedings for suspension revocation barring or denying of the persons drivers license or upon any application for renewal of driving privileges  2002   general prohibition it is unlawful to manufacture for sale sell offer or keep for sale possess or transport alcoholic liquor wine or beer except upon the terms conditions limitations and restrictions enumerated in this chapter or enumerated in state law added during 1988 codification   location of premises holding a class e liquor control license no class e liquor control license shall be issued for premises that are located within three hundred feet of a public or private educational institution added during 1988 codification   persons under legal age no person shall sell give or otherwise supply alcoholic liquor wine or beer to any person knowing or having reasonable cause to believe him or her to be under legal age and no person or persons under legal age shall individually or jointly have alcoholic liquor wine or beer in his or her or their possession or control  except in the case of liquor wine or beer given or dispensed to a person under legal age within a private home and with the knowledge and consent of the parent or guardian for beverage or medicinal purposes or as administered to him or her by either a physician or dentist for medicinal purposes and except to the extent that a person under legal age may handle alcoholic beverages and beer during the regular course of his or her employment by a liquor control licensee wine or beer permittee under state laws added during 1988 codification   consumption in cemeteries it is unlawful for any person to use or consume alcoholic liquor wine or beer within any cemetery located within the city limits amended during 1988 codification  1985 prior code  21   persons under nineteen years of age prohibited from being on certain premises at certain times a it is unlawful for the holder of a license or permit issued pursuant to the iowa alcoholic beverage control act for premises where more than fifty percent of the gross income from the business conducted is from the sale or dispensing of alcoholic beverages and for every person employed with respect to such premises to knowingly permit or fail to take reasonable measures to prevent the entry onto such premises between the hours of eight pm and two am any and all persons who have not yet attained nineteen years of age it shall also be unlawful for a person under nineteen years of age to be on the premises described in the preceding sentence between the hours of eight pm and two am b the provisions of subsection a of this section shall not apply when 1 alcoholic beverages are only sold and not consumed on the licensed premises  2 the person under nineteen years of age is an employee of the license holder or performing a contracted service with respect to said premises  3 the person under nineteen years of age is accompanied by a parent legal guardian or spouse who is twentyone years of age or older  4 the person under nineteen years of age is on the premises between the hours of eight pm and two am when the holder of a license or permit has in accordance with a written notice and plan given in advance to the chief of police suspended dispensing alcoholic beverages on the licensed premises it shall be the strict duty of the licensee permitting such underage persons onto the licensed premises pursuant to such a plan and of all persons employed with respect to said premises to prevent all persons from consuming or possessing alcoholic beverages on said premises police officers shall be admitted to the premises at any time to monitor compliance with all applicable laws failure in that duty whether knowingly or otherwise shall be punishable as a violation of this section  5 the licensed premises is under exclusive hire for a private function and is not open to the general public c the licensee or permit holder for premises described in subsection a of this section shall post a notice at a conspicuous place at the public entrance of the premises which shall state in bold letters the following no person under 19 years of age is allowed on these premises between the hours of  pm and  am unless accompanied by a parent legal guardian or spouse who is 21 years of age or older said notice shall not be smaller than eight and onehalf inches by eleven inches d the holder of a liquor license wine permit or beer permit has the burden to prove that it is exempt from the provisions of this section if less than fifty percent of the gross revenue from the business conducted is from the sale or dispensing of alcoholic beverages in order to qualify for an exemption from this section within thirty days after the ordinance codified in this section has been published a license or permit holder shall certify to the city clerk that less than fifty percent of the gross revenue from the business conducted is from the sale or dispensing of alcoholic beverages this certification shall be signed by the individual or firm who does the bookkeeping accounting or income tax return for the holder of the license or permit thereafter said verification shall be included whenever a license or permit is renewed or newly issued the city clerk or his or her designee has the right at any time to request that income tax returns or other documentation be provided to verify the certification given by the holder of the license or permit if the records or documents requested by the city clerk or his or her designee are not provided by the holder of the license or permit then the liquor license wine permit or beer permit may be suspended or revoked pursuant to the procedure set forth in this chapter additional guidelines concerning information needed to meet the requirements of the exemption may be established by the public safety committee of the city council  1993   violationpenalty a any person who is under the legal age other than a licensee or permittee who violates the provisions of this chapter regarding the purchase of or attempt to purchase alcoholic liquor wine or beer or possessing or having control of alcoholic liquor wine or beer shall be subject to a fine of two hundred dollars a second offense shall be a simple misdemeanor punishable by a fine of five hundred dollars any person who violates any other provisions of this chapter shall be subject to a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars or to imprisonment of not more than thirty days b the conviction of a liquor control licensee or of a wine or beer permittee for violation of any of the provisions of subsections a g of this chapter shall subject to subsection c of this section be grounds for the suspension or revocation of the license or permit by the division or the city however if any liquor control licensee is convicted of any violation of subsection 2 paragraph a d or e of iowa 49 or any beer permittee is convicted of a violation of subsection 2 paragraph a of said section of the iowa the beer or wine permit or liquor license shall be revoked and shall immediately be surrendered by the holder and the bond of the licensee or permit holder shall be forfeited to the state alcoholic beverages division c if any liquor licensee or beer or wine permittee or employee of such licensee or permittee is convicted of a violation of subsection e of this chapter or if a retail beer or wine permittee is convicted of a violation of subsection f of this chapter the city shall in addition to the other penalties fixed for such violations by this section assess a penalty as follows 1 upon the first conviction the violators liquor license or beer or wine permit shall be suspended for a period of fourteen days  2 upon a second conviction within a period of two years the violators liquor control license or beer or wine permit shall be suspended for a period of thirty days  3 upon a third conviction within a period of five years the violators liquor control license or beer or wine permit shall be suspended for a period of sixty days  4 upon a fourth conviction within a period of five years the violators liquor control license or beer or wine permit shall be revoked d if any liquor license or beer or wine permittee or employee of such licensee or permittee is convicted of a violation of this chapter the city shall assess a penalty as follows 1 upon the first conviction the violator shall be assessed a civil penalty in the amount of one hundred dollars failure to pay the civil penalty will result in automatic suspension of the violators liquor license or beer or wine permit for a period of fourteen days  2 upon a second conviction within a period of two years the violators liquor control license or beer or wine permit shall be suspended for a period of thirty days  3 upon a third conviction within a period of five years the violators liquor control license or beer or wine permit shall be suspended for a period of sixty days  4 upon a fourth conviction within a period of five years the violators liquor control license or beer or wine permit shall be revoked  2007   1993  added during 1988 codification cigarette retailers definitions for use in this chapter the following terms are defined a cigarette means any roll for smoking made wholly or in part of tobacco irrespective of size or shape and irrespective of being flavored adulterated or mixed with any other ingredient where such roll has a wrapper or cover made of paper or any other material it also shall mean cigarette papers wrappers and tubes it further includes cigarellos provided their weight does not exceed three pounds per thousand however this definition shall not be construed to include cigars b place of business means any building or structure in which cigarettes are sold or are kept for the purpose of sale by a retailer c retailer means every individual firm corporation or other association that sells distributes or offers for sale for consumption or possesses for the purpose of sale for consumption cigarettes irrespective of the quantity or amount or the number of sales 01   permit required no retailer shall sell distribute or solicit the sale of any cigarettes within the city without a valid permit for each place of business the permit shall be displayed publicly in the place of business so that it can be seen easily by the public no permit shall be issued to a minor 02   application and filing procedures a completed application on forms provided by the state department of revenue and accompanied by the fee provided in be filed with the clerk renewal applications shall be filed at least five days prior to the last regular meeting of the council in june if a renewal application is not timely filed and a special council meeting is called to act on the application the costs of such special meeting shall be paid by the applicant 03   issuance and renewal fees the fee for issuing or renewing a cigarette permit shall be as follows for permits issued or renewed during fee july august or september $7500 october november or december 5625 january february or march 3750 april may or june 1875 04   permitissuance or renewal the council shall issue or renew a permit upon a determination that such issuance or renewal will not be detrimental to the public health safety or morals and shall certify its action in issuing a permit to the state department of revenue 05   transferability to other locations a permit shall not be transferable to another place of business or retailer however if a retailer who holds a valid permit changes his place of business the council if it decides to issue a new permit to him shall not charge any additional fee for the unexpired term of the original permit if the retailer has not received a refund for surrender of the original permit 06   permitexpiration permits expire on june 30th of each year 07   refunds for unused periodsexceptions a retailer may surrender an unrevoked permit and receive a refund from the city except during april may or june as follows permits surrendered during amount of refund july august or september $5625 october november or december 3750 january february or march 1875 08   permitrevocationhearingnotice the council after notice and hearing shall revoke a permit if it finds the retailer has substantially violated the provisions of this chapter or iowa 197 or if grounds exist that would be sufficient for refusal to issue such a permit the clerk shall give ten days written notice to the retailer by mailing a copy of the notice by certified mail to the place of business as it appears on his application for a permit the notice shall state the reason for the contemplated revocation and the time and place at which he may appear and be heard the hearing shall be held at the regular meeting place of the council amended during 1988 codification  prior code  7209   permitrenewal after revocation upon revocation no new permit shall be issued to the retailer or for the place of business for one year from the date of revocation unless good cause to the contrary is shown the council 10 electricians definitions for the purposes of this chapter the following definitions shall apply apprentice electrician means any person working as an electrician and not having otherwise satisfied the city examiner with respect to his or her status and having no license as a master or a journeyman electrician electric wiring means the installing in any structure building or place of wires conduits cables meters transformers fixtures outlets connections and other apparatus for bringing in a supply of electric current from any electric light or power circuit and distributing the same for use therein electric wiring shall not include ordinary electric apparatus or equipment designed to plug into an existing outlet journeyman electrician means any qualified and competent electrician who shall have worked at least one year as an apprentice electrician as previously defined or who shall have had experience equivalent thereto and who shall have satisfied the citys licensing requirements master electrician means any person firm or corporation engaged in the business of installing electric wiring within the city as defined in this chapter either as contractor subcontractor or otherwise and who shall have satisfied the citys licensing requirements a master electricians license issued to a firm partnership or corporation shall bear upon the face thereof the individual name or names of the active manager or managers thereof and the license shall be deemed personal to him or her or them  and upon cessation of the active management by any party or parties named thereon the authority of anyone to continue under such license shall be automatically terminated and it is unlawful for any remaining member or members of such firm partnership or corporation to do any further work under such license under such license the holder thereof will be held responsible for all acts of the licensee and of all journeymen apprentices or others acting under him her or them or in his her or their employ the license shall not be construed to permit any holder thereof to do actual wiring as defined in this chapter unless such individual also holds a journeyman electricians license as provided in this chapter  part 1993   licenserequired no electric wiring for light heat or power shall hereafter be done made or installed in any building structure or place nor shall any alterations or extension of any existing electric wiring system be made within the city by any person firm or corporation except by an electrician duly licensed as provided in this chapter  part 1993   journeyman and apprentice electricianssupervision required no journeyman electrician shall do any electric wiring as defined in this chapter except one employed by and working under the supervision and the responsibility of a duly licensed master electrician  and no apprentice electrician shall do any electric wiring as defined in this chapter unless under the immediate supervision and direction of a duly licensed journeyman electrician no license issued under this chapter will be transferable and no licensee may delegate to another their authority or their responsibility under any license  part 1993   licenseapplication every person firm or corporation desiring an electricians license as required in this chapter shall make application to the director of public works or his or her authorized representative who will determine the qualification of the applicant the application shall be in writing and on forms furnished by the city  part 1993   licensetesting process a the director of public works or his or her authorized representative shall make available to any qualified applicant an electrical test on the current national electrical general electrical wiring knowledge within three working days of an application for an electrical test b the electrical test shall consist of not more than fifty questions on the current national electrical general electrical wiring knowledge and shall be an open book test with the applicant allowed to have and use a current national electrical along with a pockettype calculator while taking the test the test time shall be limited to a fourhour period of time for the applicant to complete the test c upon any applicants request the test may be orally administered provided that in the case of an oral test at least seven days may be allowed for the test to be arranged d upon completion of the test or after the allowed test time has expired the director of public works or his or her authorized representative shall cause the test to be corrected within three days of completion and then provide a written report on the grade received if the applicants score allows a master journeyman or masterjourneyman license shall be issued by the city clerk upon the payment of the required license fee seventy percent of the questions must be answered correctly to obtain a journeyman electricians license eightyfive percent of the questions must be answered correctly to obtain a master electricians license e any person who takes an electrical test may appeal the electric testing methods and results to a committee of the city council who in turn may employ at the expense of the applicant a qualified individual or individuals to retest the applicant if they feel the applicants complaints are justified results of this special examination shall be the final determination of whether an applicant is qualified for an electrical license  part 1993   recognition of other licenses the city examiner may also accept any one of the following qualifications as a basis for issuing a city electrical license to an individual a an electrical license as issued by a national electrical union and held by the applicant  or b an electrical license issued by another city or state in the united states that requires a similar or more extensive examination  part 1993   examination fee each person taking an examination shall pay to the clerk an examination fee of twenty dollars at the time of the filing of their application an applicant desiring to take an examination for a master electricians license and journeyman electricians license at the same time will pay but one such examination fee no examination or examination fee will be required for renewals of licenses no examination fee will be required for the issuance of an apprentice electricians license and the city examiner may authorize issuance of an apprentice electricians license without examination  part 1993   licensefees a upon satisfactorily passing the examination the applicant shall be entitled to his license to be issued by the city clerk upon payment of a license fee according to the following schedule 1 master journeyman electrician original license thirtyfive dollars  annual renewal thirtyfive dollars  2 master electrician original license twenty dollars  annual renewal twenty dollars  3 journeyman electrician original license fifteen dollars  annual renewal fifteen dollars  4 apprentice electrician original license five dollars  annual renewal five dollars b licenses issued under this chapter shall expire on april 1st next following issuance but may be renewed from year to year upon application therefor and payment of the required renewal fee no examination is required for any renewals  part 1993   exceptions to license requirements a person who is an employee of algona municipal utilities shall not be required to obtain a license pursuant to this chapter in order to perform his or her duties as an employee  part 1993   rules for installation all electrical light and power wiring and installations and all electrical fixtures and appliances and all electric work and materials used or installed within the city shall comply with and conform to the latest rules and requirements of the national electric the national board of fire underwriters and any revisions thereof and amendments and additions thereto which shall govern in all cases not otherwise covered by the provisions hereof and shall also comply with all city laws now or hereafter adopted all existing apparatus wiring fixtures and appliances shall be made to conform to the requirements of this chapter when so ordered by the council  part 1993   outstanding licenses licenses not outstanding will not be affected by this chapter anything in this chapter to the contrary notwithstanding and holders of licenses as of the data the ordinance codified in this chapter is adopted will be permitted to operate thereunder until the date their license expires said outstanding licenses may then be renewed as provided in  part 1993   licenses and certificatesdisplay required every holder of a license or certificate shall keep their license or certificate displayed in a conspicuous place in their places of business at all times license cards should be carried by all licensed electricians and shall be shown to city officials upon request  part 1993   licenserevocation any license issued pursuant to the provisions of this chapter may be revoked by the city council at any time for violation by the licensee of any of the provisions of this chapter or the rules and regulations made pursuant thereto and wholly without obligation upon the part of the city to refund any part or all of the examination fee or the license fee paid by the licensee determination of such violation by a majority vote of the city council shall be final  part 1993   violationpenalty anyone violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall upon conviction be subject to imprisonment not exceeding thirty days or to the payment of a fine not exceeding one hundred dollars each day that a violation occurs shall be considered a separate offense  part 1993 peddlers solicitors and transient merchants purpose of chapter the purpose of this chapter is to establish reasonable regulations and restrictions for the practices of peddlers solicitors and transient merchants involved with the sale of goods who may become a nuisance and endanger the safety and welfare of residents of the city and also to protect the residents of the city against fraud and intrusion into the privacy of their homes amended during 1988 codification prior code  7   definitions a for use in this chapter the following terms are defined 1 peddler means any person carrying goods or merchandise who sells or offers for sale for immediate delivery such goods or merchandise from housetohouse or upon the public street 2 solicitor means any person who solicits or attempts to solicit from housetohouse or upon public streets orders for commercial goods wares subscriptions publications perdiocals insurance merchandise or services to be delivered or fulfilled at a future date for the purpose of this chapter solicitor does not include a person who contacts another person at his or her residence without prior invitation to enlist support for or against or solicit funds for patriotic philanthropic charitable political or religious purposes whether or not there is an incidental purpose involving the sale of some goods or service 3 transient merchant means every merchant whether an individual person a firm corporation partnership or association who brings or causes to be brought within the city any goods wares or merchandise of any kind nature or description with the intention of temporarily or intermittently selling or offering to sell at retail such goods wares or merchandise temporary association with a local merchant dealer trader or auctioneer for conducting such transient business in connection with as a part of or in the name of any local merchant dealer trader or auctioneer does not exempt any such person firm or corporation from being considered a transient merchant a merchant engaging in business shall be presumed to be temporarily or intermittently in business unless it is the intention of such merchant to remain continuously in business at each location where the merchant is engaged in business within the city as a merchant for a period of more than sixty days b the provisions of this chapter shall not be construed to apply to persons selling at wholesale to merchants nor to persons running a huckster wagon or selling or distributing livestock feeds fresh meats fish fruit or vegetables nor to persons selling their own work or production either by themselves or their employees  1990  amended during 1988 codification prior code  7   licenserequired any person engaging in peddling soliciting or in the business of a transient merchant in this city without first obtaining a license as provided in this chapter shall be in violation of this chapter    exemptions from chapter provisions the following are excluded from the application of this chapter a newspaper carriers  b members of local boy scout girl scout campfire girls 4h clubs future farmers of america and similar organizations  c farmers who offer for sale products of their own raising  d students representing the area school districts conducting projects sponsored by organizations recognized by the school  e persons engaged in the business of delivering food dairy products or other materials or products customarily used in the home at the request of and pursuant to an agreement with the occupant of the premises where deliveries are made  f persons customarily calling on businesses or institutions for the purposes of selling products for resale or institutional use g persons conducting garage sales of their personal property of less than five consecutive days duration  h auction sales of personal property or real estate at the location of the property offered for sale  i persons involved with activities conducted promoted or sponsored by the algona chamber of commerce or the kossuth county fair board  3 1990  prior code  7   exemption for sale of magazine subscriptions a any applicant who contacts another person at his or her residence to solicit magazine subscriptions must file with the city clerk an application in writing which shall give the following information 1 the name and address of the applicant  2 the names and addresses of the officers of the organization  3 an outline of the methods to be used in conducting the solicitations  4 the length of time for which the permit is desired  5 the number of agents or solicitors to be used in the solicitation campaign b upon the furnishing of the information required in this chapter the applicant shall be issued free of charge a license  2002   charitable political and religious organizations a any applicant who contacts another person at his or her residence without prior invitation to solicit funds for or against or to sell some goods or service for patriotic philanthropic charitable political or religious purposes must file with the city clerk an application in writing which shall give the following information 1 the name and address of the applicant  2 the names and addresses of the officers of the organization  3 an outline of the methods to be used in conducting the solicitations  4 the length of time for which the permit is desired  5 the number of agents or solicitors to be used in the solicitation campaign  6 whether any commissions fees or wages are to be charged by the solicitor for his efforts and the amount thereof b upon the furnishing of the information required in this chapter the applicant shall be issued free of charge a license c any applicant who contacts another person at his or her residence without prior invitation to simply enlist support for or against or to spread information for philanthropic charitable political or religious purposes shall not be required to make any filing with the city clerk as contemplated under the ordinance codified in this section as no license is required  2002 amended during 1988 codification prior code  7   licenseapplication any applicant engaged in any activity described in this chapter must file with the city clerk an application in writing that gives the following information a name date of birth and social security number  b physical description of applicant  c permanent and local address and in the case of transient merchants the local address from which proposed sales will be made  d a right thumb print  e a recent photograph  f a brief description of the nature of the applicants business  g name and address of the firm for or on whose behalf the orders are solicited or the supplier of the goods offered for sale  h the address of the last three places of such business  i length of time to be sought to be covered by the license  j motor vehicle makes model year color and license number if a vehicle is to be used in the proposed solicitation  k a statement as to whether the applicant has been convicted of any crime other than a simple misdemeanor and if so the nature of the offense and the penalty imposed  l if the applicant is a peddler he or she must also obtain a certificate signed by a local physician that the applicant is in good health and free from any contagious diseases amended during 1988 codification prior code  7   bond required before a license under this chapter is issued each person shall post a bond by a surety company authorized to engage in the business of insuring the fidelity of others in the state in the amount of one thousand dollars with the clerk to the effect that the registrant and the surety shall consent to the forfeiture of the principal sum of the bond or such part thereof as may be necessary a to indemnify the city for any penalties or costs occasioned by the enforcement of this chapter  and b to make payment of any judgment rendered against the registrant as a result of a claim or litigation arising out of or in connection with such registrants peddling or solicitation the bond shall not be retired until after a lapse of one year from the expiration of the license which it covers amended during 1988 codification prior code  7   licensefees the following license fees shall be paid to the clerk prior to the issuance of any license a for one day or any part thereof twenty dollars  b for one month or any part thereof two hundred dollars  1990  amended during 1988 codification prior code  7   licenseissuance if the clerk finds the application is completed in conformance with this chapter and the facts stated therein are found to be correct the required bond is posted and the license fee paid a license shall be issued immediately    licensedisplay each solicitor or peddler shall at all times while doing business in this city keep in his possession the license provided for in this chapter and shall upon the request of prospective customers exhibit the license as evidence that he has complied with all requirements of this chapter each transient merchant shall display publicly his license in his place of business    licensetransferability licenses issued under the provisions of this chapter are not transferable in any situation and are to be applicable only to the person filing the application amended during 1988 codification prior code  7   prohibited solicitation periods no peddler or solicitor as defined under this chapter may conduct those defined activities except between the hours of eight am and six pm on each day and no solicitation or peddling shall be done on sundays or legal holidays amended during 1988 codification prior code  7   licenserevocation after notice and hearing the clerk may revoke any license issued under this chapter for the following reasons a fraudulent statements the licensee has made fraudulent statements in his application for the license or in the conduct of his business  b violation of law the licensee has violated this chapter or has otherwise conducted his business in an unlawful manner  c endangered public welfare health or safety the licensee has conducted his business in such manner as to endanger the public welfare safety order or morals    complaintsservice of written notice the license holder and the surety on his bond shall be served with written notice containing particulars of the complaints against him the ordinance provisions or state statutes allegedly violated and the date time and place for hearing on the matter    complaintshearing the clerk shall conduct a hearing at which both the licensee and any complainants shall be present to determine the truth of the facts alleged in the complaint and notice should the licensee or his authorized representative fail to appear without good cause the clerk may proceed to a determination of the complaint    complaintsrecord and determination the clerk shall make and record findings of fact and conclusion of law and shall revoke a license only when upon review of the entire record he finds clear and convincing evidence of substantial violation of this chapter or state law    appeal if the clerk revokes or refuses to issue a license he shall make a part of the record his reasons therefor the licensee or the applicant shall have a right to a hearing before the council at its next regular meeting the council may reverse modify or affirm the decision of the clerk by a majority vote of the council members present and the clerk shall carry out the decision of the council    effect of revocation revocation of any license shall bar the licensee from being eligible for any license under this chapter for a period of one year from the date of the revocation    obstructions of pedestrian or vehicular traffic unlawful no person while engaged in any of the practices described in this chapter shall block or obstruct the path of any pedestrian or vehicular traffic or block or obstruct any way of ingress or egress to roads buildings vehicles or other enclosures or conveyances added during 1988 codification   violationpenalty any person violating the provisions of this chapter shall upon conviction be subject to imprisonment not exceeding thirty days or a fine not exceeding one hundred dollars each day that a violation continues shall constitute a separate offense added during 1988 codification regulation of vendor activity and outdoor entertainment during the ragbrai event vendor permit no person or entity other than the algona licensed establishments shall provide or sell food or other merchandise to the public in algona on july 24 and 25 201 unless the person or entity has first obtained a vendors permit from the algona ragbrai committee or its authorized designee the ordinance codified in this chapter supersedes for these two days dealing with peddlers solicitors and transient merchants an exception to this requirement is provided in part 2005      vendor fees the fee for a vendor permit shall be as follows a base rate the base rate shall be as follows 1 three hundred dollars for a nonprofit vendor  2 seven hundred dollars for a for profit vendor  b utility fee in addition to the base rate each vendor shall be subjected to the assessment of an additional fee for any utilities which the vendor requests or which it is determined are necessary to adequately service the vendors location this utility fee shall not exceed one hundred fifty dollars per day and shall be determined and paid prior to the issuance of the vendor permit c cleaning deposit each vendor shall provide a one hundred dollar refundable cleaning deposit the cleaning deposit shall be refunded after inspection by a member the food service committee of the algona ragbrai committee provided the vendors site is cleaned to the same condition in which the vendor received it if the site is not properly cleaned the cost of cleaning the site will be deducted from the deposit and the food service committee shall furnish the vendor an accounting for his deposit part 2005      location and lawful operation each vendor permit shall be granted and remain valid only on condition that the vendor locate at an approved location as designated in the vendor permit and comply with all the applicable federal state county and municipal laws ordinances rules and regulations use of the public rightofway in connection with a vendor permit or outdoor entertainment permit and placing signs in the public rightofway in connection with said permits is hereby allowed part 2005      outdoor entertainment no outdoor entertainment shall be held on  in algona iowa without first obtaining an outdoor entertainment permit from the clerk of the city of algona upon recommendation of the algona ragbrai committee or its authorized subcommittee any outdoor entertainment permit shall be subject to the following rules 1 decibel level of outdoor entertainment shall be reasonable for circumstances time and location and shall be subject to the control of the chief of police of algona 2 outdoor sales of alcoholic beverages shall be permitted only in full compliance with the iowa and appropriate license by the state of iowa 3 the outdoor entertainment permit is not transferable 4 all sponsors shall be subject to fees at the same rate and upon the same terms as applied to vendor fees in however entertainment sponsors providing entertainment on their own property shall not be required to pay a fee for the issuance of this permit part 2005      appeals if permit is denied the vendor may appeal the matter to the algona city council further upon request by any person challenging the granting of a permit the matter shall be submitted to the algona city council for review if after hearing the algona city council finds that any proposed entertainment event poses an unacceptable risk to public safety health or welfare it may confirm the denial of the permit or deny the issuance of a permit or may restrict with conditions the issuance of a permit as determined advisable by the council further if the algona city council finds that the proposed entertainment event poses an acceptable risk to public safety health or welfare it may issue the permit part 2005      nuisance the sale of food merchandise or beverages or the location of a stand for the sale of food merchandise or beverages or the provision of outdoor entertainment in violation of this chapter is hereby declared to be a nuisance the algona police chief or his designees are hereby empowered to cause any offending stand or outdoor entertainment or place in violation of this chapter to be immediately dismantled and removed without notice part 2005      misdemeanor it shall be a simple misdemeanor for any person or entity to violate any of the provisions of the ordinance codified herein part 2005      exception it shall not be a violation of this chapter and no vendor permit shall be required for a person or entity to sell or supply food or merchandise in algona on july 24 and 25 2017 on his or its previously licensed premises provided that the person or entity was in possession of a current iowa permit for the sale of food for consumption on that premises as of  compliance with this chapter shall be deemed to be in compliance with the algona city ordinances for the dates of july 24 and 25 2017 part 2005    tree surgeons tree surgeon defined tree surgeon as used in this chapter means any person firm or corporation who solicits the work of cutting down a tree or who cuts or trims any tree or limb or branch of any tree or who offers services in the diagnosis and treatment of the diseases of any tree for a valuable consideration  part 1979 prior code  23501   certificate requiredinsurance coverage every tree surgeon shall before engaging in any service designated in this chapter within the corporate limits of the city obtain and file with the city clerk a certificate of an issued public liability insurance policy with a provision for at least a tenday notice by the insurance carrier of cancellation thereof insuring against any loss that the city or any person firm or corporation may sustain arising out of or in connection with such services performed by such tree surgeon such insurance shall be in an amount of not less than three hundred thousand dollars property damage three hundred thousand dollars for a single personal injury or death and with limits of not less than three hundred thousand dollars for aggregate personal injuries or death this insurance coverage shall be in addition to the vehicle public liability insurance required for any car or truck operated by the tree surgeon in his business  part 1979 prior code  23502   trimming rights of city and public utilities nothing in this chapter shall be construed to prohibit the city the algona municipal utilities north central public service company and northwestern bell telephone company from performing tree trimming and cutting of trees for rightofway and maintenance of their utility lines and public services  part 1979 prior code  23503   violationpenalty anyone violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall upon conviction be subject to imprisonment not exceeding thirty days or a fine not exceeding one hundred dollars  part 1979 prior code  23504 house movers house mover defined house mover means any person who undertakes to move a building or similar structure upon over or across the public streets alleys walks or property using skids jacks dollies or any method other than upon a properly licensed motor vehicle    purpose of chapter the purpose of this chapter is to protect and preserve the public safety and wellbeing by licensing and regulating house and building movers    licenserequired it shall be unlawful for any person to engage in the activity of house mover as defined in this chapter without a valid license from the city for each house building or similar structure to be moved    applicationcontents application for a house movers license shall be made in writing to the clerk the application shall include a name and address the applicants full name and address and if a corporation the names and addresses of its principal officers  b building location an accurate description of the present location and future site of the building or similar structure to be moved  c routing plan a routing plan approved by the police chief street superintendent and public utility officials the route approved shall be the shortest route compatible with the greatest public convenience and safety    bond required the applicant shall post with the clerk a penal bond in the sum of one thousand dollars issued by a surety company authorized to issue such bonds in the state the bond shall guarantee the licensees payment for any damage done to the city or to public property and payment of all costs incurred by the city in the course of moving the building or structure    certificate of insurance required each applicant shall also have filed a certificate of insurance indicating that he is carrying public liability insurance in effect for the duration of the license covering himself and his agents and employees for the following amounts a bodily injury fifty thousand dollars per person  one hundred thousand dollars per accident  b property damage fifty thousand dollars per accident    utility line movingnotice a the person firm or corporation moving any such building shall also give written notice at least twentyfour hours before the time of moving the same to the electric light company telephone company and any other public service corporation whose property upon the streets and alleys of the city may be endangered or interfered with by the moving of such building which notice shall specify the time and place of moving the same and the streets and alleys over which the building is to be moved b after the service of the notice provided for above it shall be the duty of any public service corporation whose property is located upon or over the streets and alleys of the city and whose property is an obstruction to the movement of the building over the streets and alleys upon the payment by the owner of such building or the party moving the same of the reasonable expense of removing such obstructions and replacing the same after the building has been moved to temporarily move the obstructions so as to enable the building to pass the obstruction    licensefee a license fee of fifteen dollars shall be payable at the time of filing the application with the clerk a separate license shall be required for each house building or similar structure to be moved    licenseissuance upon completion of the application filing of bond and insurance certificate and payment of the required fee the clerk shall issue a license    public safety procedures at all times when a building or similar structure is in motion upon any street alley sidewalk or public property the licensee shall maintain flagmen at the closest intersections or other possible channels of traffic to the sides behind and ahead of the building or structure at all times when the building or structure is at rest upon any street alley sidewalk or public property the licensee shall maintain adequate warning signs or flares at the intersections or channels of traffic to the sides behind and ahead of the building or structure    violation of removal by city in the event any building or similar structure is found to be in violation of this chapter the city is authorized to remove such building or structure and assess the costs thereof against the license holder and the surety on his bond    encroachment onto public rights of waytime limitations no housemover shall permit or allow a building or similar structure to remain upon any street or other public way for a period of more than twelve hours without having first secured the written approval of the city  cable television service and equipment regulation of rates the city council shall be authorized to engage in the regulation of rates for cable service of a cable system operated within the city provided that such regulation shall only be conducted in a manner which is consistent with 47 usc 543 and fcc report and order in docket 92266 fcc 93177 the terms of which including all subsequent amendments are incorporated herewith by reference  part 1993   delegation of authority the city council may for purposes of administration of such rate regulation delegate the authority granted in any qualified and acting committee or commission created by the mayor or the city council  part 1993   rate regulation proceedings the city council or its duly authorized delegate shall in all rate regulation proceedings provide a reasonable opportunity for consideration of the views of interested parties  part 1993 control of the use of public property and rightofway purpose the council finds it is necessary for the city to establish uniform rules and controls to ensure public safety and provide efficient delivery of services by the city and others wishing to utilize streets and the public property for the delivery of utility or other services in order to protect public and private investment ensure orderly use of public property and ensure the health safety and welfare of the population to provide for the regulation and administration of the public streets and the public property and secure the rights of the city to a return on its investment in public property or to recover the management costs incurred by the city this chapter is to be interpreted in light of these findings for the benefit of the public and users of the streets and other public property  1998   franchise license or lease required no person or entity shall use the public rightofway for the purpose of providing telecommunications services not including cable television systems without first obtaining a license from the city no other person or entity shall use the public rightofway or other public property without first obtaining a franchise license or lease from the city the city shall not enter into or issue any franchise license or lease that grants exclusive rights all licenses or leases required by this section shall be granted by the city council  1998   fees required no franchise license or lease for the use of public rightofway or other public property shall be granted without requiring the grantee thereof to pay fees as follows a all new franchises shall be assessed a franchise fee of up to five percent of the gross revenues received by the holder of the franchise from its operations within the city limits b a person or entity using the public rightofway for the purpose of providing telecommunications services not including cable television systems shall pay the management costs caused by the grantees activity in the public rightsofway for purposes of this chapter management costs means the reasonable costs incurred by the city in managing the public rightsofway the management costs shall be calculated and assessed by the city at the end of each calendar year and shall be due and payable by the grantee within thirty 30 days after assessment c all other holders of a license or lease shall pay a reasonable fee  1998   limit on term no franchise license or lease for use of the public rightofway or other public property shall be granted for a term of more than ten years  part 1997   placement of facilities the facilities fixtures and equipment for the distribution transmission or sale of any utility services or services provided under a license or lease shall be placed and maintained so as not to unnecessarily or unreasonably interfere with the travel on the streets highways avenues alleys bridges and public places in the city nor shall such facilities fixtures and equipment interfere with the proper use of the same including but not limited to ordinary drainage or the functioning of the sewers underground pipe or other property of the city in the event that facilities fixtures and equipment of any person or other entity located within a public rightofway must be relocated because of paving road construction or road reconstruction sewer construction or sewer reconstruction or the construction or reconstruction of public drainage systems or similar public works or the construction or reconstruction of the facilities of any cityowned utility such relocation at the written request of the city shall be completed by the owner of such facilities at the owners cost the city shall upon request of any person or other entity holding a franchise license or lease review any plans for the construction of facilities fixtures and equipment within the public rightofway and advise the person or other entity of any conflict such construction may have with planned or anticipated public improvements but failure of the city to so advise such person or other entity will not relieve the owner of such facilities of its obligations under this chapter notwithstanding the foregoing the city director of public works may require placement of equipment or facilities belonging to any holder of a franchise license or lease be limited to locations designated by the city director of public works to be necessary to protect the integrity of use of present and future users of the public rightofway or other public property  part 1997   indemnification and insurance the holder of any franchise license or lease shall indemnify and hold the city harmless at all times during the term of the franchise license or lease from and against all claims for injury or damage to any person or property including payments under workers compensation laws caused by the construction erection operation or maintenance of its facilities fixtures or equipment or the negligence of its contractors or its employees in case of any suit or action at law being commenced against the city upon any claim for damage arising out of any loss injury or damage claimed to have been caused by any installation improvement obstruction or excavation made or left in under or upon such street sidewalk alley or public place by the holder of a franchise license or lease its agents contractors or employees upon being notified in writing by the city of such action or proceeding the holder of the franchise license or lease shall appear and make proper defense thereto at the expense of the holder of the franchise license or lease  and if any judgment or decree shall in any such case be rendered against the city therein the holder of the franchise license or lease shall assume pay and satisfy such judgment or decree with the costs thereof immediately upon issuance of the franchise license or lease the holder of the franchise license or lease shall purchase general liability insurance the amount of insurance shall be a minimum of one million dollars with a maximum deductible of five thousand dollars the holder of the franchise license or lease shall file with the city clerk a certificate of insurance which clearly discloses on its face coverage in conformity with these requirements upon request of the city the holder of the franchise license or lease shall at its cost submit to the city a certified copy of the policy in lieu of such insurance the holder of a franchise license or lease may provide proof of selfinsurance which the city may deem to be an acceptable alternative  1998   part 1997   regulation by the city the city reserves the right to make reasonable general regulations for the use of streets and other public property which unless otherwise specifically provided shall apply to any holder of a franchise license or lease  part 1997   construction and excavation by holders of a franchise license or lease a written permit shall be obtained from the city director of public works whenever it becomes necessary for the holder of any franchise license or lease to excavate in streets or public grounds of the city such permits shall state a particular part or point of the street where the excavation is to be made and the length of time in which such permit shall authorize the work to be done an exception to a requirement for a permit shall be made in cases of emergency involving public safety in which case a permit will be obtained at the earliest opportunity after the work has started in making excavations in the streets the holder of any franchise license or lease shall proceed with such work as to cause the least possible inconvenience to the public the holder of any franchise license or lease shall properly protect according to safety standards generally accepted at the time of placement as may be determined from time to time by the city director of public works all excavations and obstructions by proper placement of shoring surface plates barricades warning lights and such other or additional devises as circumstances may warrant if in the opinion of the city director of public works such excavation or obstruction is not properly and safely protected the city director of public works shall notify such holder of a franchise license or lease who shall immediately comply with such reasonable instructions immediately after use any trenches for excavations which the holder of a franchise license or lease has opened shall be filled however no trench or excavation in the streets shall be filled or covered without giving the city the right to inspect the same all backfilling in streets will be according to city specifications temporary street surfacing will be placed in such excavations as soon as the same has been backfilled pavements sidewalks curbs and gutters or other portions of streets and public places opened disturbed or damaged shall be promptly restored and replaced with like materials at the expense of the holder of a franchise license or lease and left in as good condition as before the opening disturbance or damage occurred in the event like replacement materials are not available the holder of the franchise license or lease shall notify the city director of public works who must approve the use of any alternate materials in the event that the holder of a franchise license or lease fails to comply with the provision of this section after having been given reasonable notice the city may do such works as may be needed to properly repair such pavements sidewalks curbs and gutters or other portions of streets and public places and the cost thereof shall be repaid to the city by the holder of the franchise license or lease in cases where a cut or disturbance is made in a section of street paving or sidewalks but causes greater disturbance than to just the area cut rather than replace only the area cut the holder of a franchise license or lease shall replace that area as may be ordered by the city director of public works which in no event shall exceed the panel or panels disturbed  part 1997   city construction and paving whenever the city shall pave or repave any street or shall change the grade line of any street or public place or shall construct or reconstruct any conduit water main service or water connection sewer or other cityowned public works or cityowned utility it shall be the duty of the holder of any franchise license or lease when so ordered by the city to relocate its service lines and other property in the streets or other public places at its own expense so as to conform to the established grade or line of such street or public place and so as not to interfere with the public improvements so contracted or reconstructed in the case of other public improvements including but not limited to urban renewal projects the city may require the holder of a franchise license or lease to relocate its poles service lines and appurtenances in the streets at the owners expense the city may at its discretion assign personnel for inspection of excavation and related work being performed by the holder of a franchise license or lease should the holder of the franchise license or lease fail or refuse to do and perform the things provided in this section the city may after reasonable notice perform the work and charge the expense thereof to the holder of the franchise license or lease and the holder of the franchise license or lease shall promptly pay the charges  part 1997   design notice to city the holder of a franchise license or lease shall promptly upon request furnish the city director of public works a detailed map or maps of its facilities both within the city limits and the area within two miles surrounding the city unless that area is within another city the holder of a franchise license or lease shall thereafter update the map or maps at least annually or upon request showing all subsequent additions or deletions to the distribution system prior to any excavation by the city or its agents a representative must contact the holder of any franchise license or lease regarding current information on the location of underground lines or facilities in the area concerned the obligations to contact the holder of a franchise license or lease under this section shall be satisfied if contact is made with a corporation organized pursuant to of the iowa 1997 as amended or an entity with a similar function utilized by both the city and the company currently the iowa one call system  part 1997   aboveground cables wires conduits and poles all new cables wires and conduits shall be placed underground except where aboveground connection to buildings or other locations above ground is reasonably necessary such aboveground connection shall be by means of poles located as far as reasonably practical within alleys no such poles shall be installed or erected until the city director of public works has approved the proposed location construction and pole heights the replacement or upgrading of existing cables wires and conduits need not be placed underground unless necessary for the public health welfare or safety  1998   assignment no sale or assignment of any franchise license or lease of the use of the public rightofway or other public property shall be effective until it is approved by the city council and until the holder thereof has filed in the office of the city clerk written notice of the proposed sale transfer disposition assignment such notice to clearly summarize the proposed procedure and the terms and conditions thereof if the city determines it needs additional information the holder of the franchise license or lease shall be required to provide the information the city shall be reimbursed by the holder of the franchise license or lease for its reasonable costs incurred in reviewing all matters relating to the sale or assignment including the reasonable costs for consultants or technical experts such approval by the city shall not be unreasonably withheld the proposed vendee assignee or lessee shall similarly file an instrument duly executed reciting such proposal accepting the terms of the franchise license or lease and agreeing to perform all of the conditions thereof  part 1997   forfeiture the violation of any material portion of a franchise license or lease by the holder thereof or its successors or assigns or its failure promptly to perform any of the provisions of this
