chapter shall be cause for forfeiture of the franchise license or lease and the termination of all rights thereunder such forfeiture shall be accomplished by ordinance of the city after written notice to the holder thereof and a continuation of the violation failure or default specified on the notice for at least thirty days from the date the notice was served  part 1997   application this chapter shall apply to all franchises licenses or leases and easements granted by the city including all existing franchises licenses or leases and easements  part 1997   removal of materialbond required the holder of any franchise license or lease at the termination of the franchise license or lease shall remove from the public property or public rightofway whatever was placed in the rightofway and shall restore the property to a condition reasonably comparable to the condition it was in prior to the rightofway being used before a franchise license or lease is issued to any person or entity a bond shall be obtained to insure that the holder of the franchise license or lease shall be responsible for removing whatever was placed in the public property or rightofway and to further insure that the public property or rightofway shall be restored to a condition reasonably comparable to the condition it was in prior to the rightofway being used the amount of the bond to be secured shall be determined by the city and shall be dependent upon the amount of cable wire or other material that is being placed in the rightofway and the estimated cost it would take to remove the material and restore the property at the expiration of the franchise license or lease in lieu of such bond the holder of a franchise license or lease may provide proof of selfinsurance which the city many deem to be an acceptable alternative  1998   part 1997   home rule this chapter is intended to be and shall be construed as consistent with the reservation of local authority contained in the 25th amendment to the iowa constitution granting cities home rule powers to such end any limitation on the power of the city contained herein is to be strictly construed and the city reserves to itself the right to exercise all power and authority to regulate and control its local affairs and all ordinances and regulations of the city shall be enforceable against the holder of any franchise license or lease  part 1997   new technologies should within the term of any franchise license or lease developments within the field for which the grant was made offer to the holder thereof the opportunity to effectively efficiently and economically serve its customers of a substance or material other than those for which the grant was originally made then the holder of the franchise license or lease may petition the city council which with such requirements or limitations as it deems necessary to protect public health safety and welfare may allow the use of such substance under the terms and conditions of the franchise license or lease  part 1997 title 6  animals animal control regulations generally definitions for use in this chapter the following terms are defined 1 animal means all living creatures not human 2 at large means any animal found off the premises of its owner and not under the control of a competent person an animal shall not be deemed at large if a the animal is on the owners property or another persons property with that persons consent  or b the animal is confined in a cage or motor vehicle  or c the animal is restrained by a lead of six feet or less or on a leash of sufficient strength to control the animals action  or d the animal is at heel under the control of a competent person and obedient to that persons command  or e the animal is housed in a veterinary clinic or kennel  or f the animal is a draft animal engaged in drawing vehicles  or g a dog is actively engaged in training in dog obedience for hunting or for other service under continual control of his or her owner or trainer provided that the owner or trainer is conducting the training in an open public area and is not endangering other users or animals in the area 3 dangerous animal means a any animal which is not naturally tame or gentle and which is of a wild nature or disposition and which is capable of killing inflicting serious injury upon or causing disease among human beings or domestic animals and having known tendencies as a species to do so  b any animals declared to be dangerous by the county board of health or the city council or its designee  c the following animals shall be deemed to be dangerous animals per se i wolves coyotes and foxes ii badgers wolverines weasels mink and other mustelids except ferrets iii bears iv all apes including chimpanzees baboons and macaques v monkeys except the squirrel monkey vi elephants vii wild boar viii black widow spiders and scorpions ix snakes and reptiles which are naturally venomous or poisonous and snakes that are constrictors over six feet in length x all cats except domestic cats carnivora of the family felidae including but not limited to lions cougars tigers jaguars leopards lynx bobcats etc xi raccoons oppossums and skunks xii alligators crocodiles and caymans 4 dog means members of the canine species male or female whether neutered or not 5 domestic animal means and includes all dogs and cats and all other small common nonlivestock animals etc kept by owners and that are reasonably termed as pets 6 license means a current license issued by kossuth county iowa 7 livestock means and includes all animals that are normally owned for agricultural or recreational purposes on farms and ranches including but not limited to cattle horses sheep swine mules ponies goats or poultry 8 owner means any person or persons owning keeping sheltering or harboring an animal 9 person means any individual association partnership or corporation and includes any officer employee or agency thereof 10 vicious animal means any animal including a dog except for a dangerous animal per se as listed above that has bitten or clawed a person or persons one time while running at large and the attack was unprovoked or any animal that has exhibited vicious propensities in present or past conduct including such that such animal a has bitten or clawed a person or persons on two separate occasions  or b did bite or claw once causing injuries above the shoulders of a person  or c could not be controlled or restrained by the owner at the time of the attack to prevent the occurrence  or d has attacked any domestic animal or fowl on two separate occasions  or e which has been found to possess such propensity by the city council after hearing 11 vicious dog means a any dog which has attacked a human being or domestic animal one or more times without provocation  or b any dog with a history tendency or disposition to attack to cause injury or to otherwise endanger the safety of human beings or domestic animals  or c any dog that snaps bites or manifests a disposition to snap or bite  or d any dog that has been trained for dog fighting animal fighting or animal baiting or is owned or kept for such purposes  or e any dog trained to attack human beings upon command or spontaneously in response to human activities except dogs owned by and under the control of the police department a law enforcement agency of the state or the united states or a branch of the armed forces of the united states  or f staffordshire terrier breed of dog  or g the american pit bull terrier breed of dog  or h the american staffordshire terrier breed of dog  or i dogs of mixed breed or of other breeds than above listed which breed or mixed breed is known as pit bulls pit bull dogs or pit bull terriers  or j any dog which has the appearance and characteristics of being predominately of the breeds of staffordshire terrier american pit bull terrier american staffordshire terrier  any other breed commonly known as pit bulls pit bull dogs or pit bull terriers or a combination of any of these breeds  1992  added during 1988 codification   general licensing requirements all licenses required for dogs shall be obtained from the county auditor pursuant to the provisions of of the iowa in addition an owner of a vicious dog shall also provide in writing to the city clerk the following information a the name and address of the owner of the vicious dog  b the breed sex age color markings and name if any of the dog  c the serial number of the license obtained for the dog from the county auditor this shall be done on an annual basis on or before the first day of february each year  d a copy of an insurance policy issued by an insurance company licensed to do business in this state providing personal liability insurance coverage as in a homeowners policy with a minimum liability amount of fifty thousand dollars for the injury or death of any person for damage to property of others and for acts of negligence by the owner or his or her agents in the negligent keeping of such vicious dog in addition a copy of the declaration sheet received from the insurance company shall be provided to the city clerk whenever such insurance policy is renewed the cancellation or other termination of any insurance policy presented to comply with this section shall automatically revoke and terminate the license issued by the county auditor unless another policy complying with this section shall be provided and in effect at the time of such cancellation or termination no person shall be required to present a certificate of insurance to comply with this section  e within ten days of the incident 1 the new address of a vicious dog owner should the owner move within the corporate limits of the city 2 the removal from the city or death of a vicious animal 3 the birth of offspring of a vicious dog  f if the owner of a vicious dog has not provided the information required by this section the dog shall be considered unlicensed and may be impounded as provided in this chapter added during 1988 codification   immunization required when all owners of animals shall have their animals which are six months of age or older vaccinated against rabies unless the animals are of the type for which such immunization is not considered by a licensed veterinarian to be medically necessary in addition all owners shall have their animals obtain any booster shots required after the initial rabies vaccination a tag showing evidence of proper vaccination shall be worn by every animal when not confined animals kept in the city pound shall not be subject to the vaccination requirement added during 1988 codification   keeping dangerous animalsunlawfulexceptions no person shall keep shelter or harbor any dangerous animal as a pet nor act as a temporary custodian for such animal nor keep shelter or harbor such animal for any other purpose or in any other capacity within the city except in the following circumstances a the keeping of dangerous animals for exhibition to the public by a circus carnival exhibit or show where such circus carnival exhibit or show is of a traveling nature is displayed before large assemblages of people and maintains any and all required federal or state licenses  b the keeping of dangerous animals in a bonafied licensed veterinary hospital for treatment  c the keeping of dangerous animals by a wildlife rescue organization with appropriate permit from the iowa conservation commission  d any dangerous animals under the jurisdiction of and in the possession of the iowa conservation commission pursuant to chapters 109 and 109a of the iowa added during 1988 codification   keeping dangerous animalsimpoundment a in the event that a dangerous animal is found at large and unattended upon public property park property public rightofway or the property of someone other than its owner thereby creating a hazard to person or property such animal may in the discretion of the chief of police be destroyed if it cannot be confined or captured the city shall be under no duty to attempt the confinement or capture of a dangerous animal found at large nor shall it have a duty to notify the owner of such animal prior to its destruction b upon the written complaint of any individual that a person is keeping sheltering or harboring a dangerous animal on premises located in the city or in his discretion the chief of police shall cause the matter to be investigated if after investigation the facts indicate that the person named in the complaint is keeping sheltering or harboring a dangerous animal in the city the chief of police shall order the person named in the complaint to safely remove such animal from the city and permanently place the animal with an organization or group allowed under this chapter to possess dangerous animals or destroy the animal within three days of the receipt of such order such order shall be contained in a notice to remove the dangerous animal which notice shall be given in writing to the person keeping sheltering or harboring the dangerous animal and shall be served personally by a police officer or by certified mail such order and notice to remove the dangerous animal shall not be required where such dangerous animal has previously caused serious physical harm or death to any person in which case the chief of police shall cause the animal to be immediately seized and impounded or killed if seizure and impoundment are not possible without risk of serious physical harm or death to any person c the order to remove a dangerous animal issued by the chief of police may be appealed to the city council in order to appeal such order written notice of appeal must be filed with the city clerk within three days after receipt of the order contained in the notice to remove dangerous animal failure to file such written notice of appeal shall constitute a waiver of right to appeal the order of the chief of police d the notice of appeal shall state the grounds for such appeal and shall be delivered personally or by certified mail to the city clerk the hearing of such appeal shall be scheduled within twenty days of the receipt of notice of appeal the person requesting the hearing shall be given not less than seventytwo hours written notice of the time and place of such hearing the notice shall be served by a city police officer personally upon the person or shall be served by certified mail the hearing may be continued for good cause after such hearing the city council may affirm or reverse the order of the chief of police such determination shall be contained in a written decision and shall be filed with the city clerk within three days after the hearing or any continued session thereof e if the city council affirms the action of the chief of police the council shall order in its written decision that the individual or entity owning sheltering harboring or keeping such dangerous animal remove such animal from the city permanently place such animal with an organization or group allowed under this chapter to possess dangerous animals or destroy it the decision and order shall immediately be served upon the person or entity against whom rendered in the same manner as the notice of removal if the original order of the chief of police is not appealed and is not complied with within three days or the order of the city council after appeal is not complied with within three days of its issuance the chief of police is authorized to seize and impound such dangerous animal an animal so seized shall be impounded for a period of seven days if at the end of the impoundment period the individual or entity against whom the decision and order of the city council was issued has not petitioned the county district court for a review of such order and provided a copy of the petition to the city clerk the city shall cause the animal to be disposed of by sale permanently place such animal with an organization or group allowed under this chapter to possess dangerous animals or destroy such animal in a humane manner f failure to comply with an order of the chief of police issued pursuant hereto and not appealed or of the city council and not successfully appealed is a misdemeanor added during 1988 codification   vicious animals and vicious dogsconfinement required no person shall keep shelter or harbor for any reason within the city a vicious animal or vicious dog so defined in this chapter except for vicious dogs that are licensed and also confined as required by this section a all vicious dogs shall be securely confined within an occupied house or residence or in a securely enclosed and locked pen or kennel except when leashed and muzzled provided below such pen kennel or structure must have secure sides and a secure top attached to the sides or in lieu of a top walls at least six feet in height and at least six feet taller than any internal structure b all pens or other structures designed constructed or used to confine vicious dogs must be locked with a key or combination lock when such animals are within the structure such structure must have a secure bottom floor or foundation attached to the sides of the pen or the sides of the pen must be embedded in the ground no less than two feet so as to prevent digging under the walls by the confined dog c all structures erected to house vicious dogs must comply with all zoning and building regulations of the city all such structures must be adequately lighted and ventilated and kept in a clean and sanitary condition all such structures must be large enough to accommodate the animal and not cause the animal any harm no vicious dog may be kept on a porch patio or in any part of a house or structure that would allow the dog to exit such building on its own volition d no person shall permit a vicious dog to go outside its kennel or pen unless such dog is securely leashed with a leash no longer than six feet in length no person shall permit a vicious dog to be kept on a chain rope or other type of leash outside its kennel or pen unless both dog and leash are under the actual physical control of a person eighteen years of age or older in addition a vicious dog on a leash outside its kennel or pen must be muzzled by a muzzling device sufficient to prevent such dog from biting persons or other animals e a vicious dog may not be leashed to inanimate objects such as trees posts buildings or any other object or structure f if the chief of police determines that a vicious dog is not confined as set forth in this section the dog may be seized impounded and disposed of and the procedure set forth in this chapter shall be followed to determine whether it was properly confined the person shall be required to either confine the dog as required by this chapter remove the dog from the city or allow the dog to be destroyed g failure to confine a vicious dog as required by this section is a misdemeanor added during 1988 codification   vicious dogsimpoundment and destructionrequired when a vicious dog which is found more than once to not be confined as required by this chapter shall be required to be permanently removed from the city or destroyed an animal which is returned to the city after removal under this section shall be destroyed added during 1988 codification   vicious dogsimpoundment and destructionexceptions all unlicensed vicious dogs shall be deemed vicious animals the person harboring or keeping an unlicensed vicious dog may have the animal removed from the city if however the animal is again found unlicensed in the city or if the person holding or keeping the animal chooses not to remove it from the city then the dog shall be destroyed this section shall not apply to a dog which upon initial notice to its owner the owner agrees to properly license and confine  or to a dog for which a hearing has been requested under this chapter to determine if it is vicious until there has been a final decision on the question raised at the hearing at which time the owner may if the dog is found vicious properly license and confine the dog added during 1988 codification   vicious animalsinvestigationappeals of determinations a the chief of police or his designee in his discretion or upon receipt of a complaint alleging that a particular animal is a vicious animal which can include a dog or a vicious dog shall cause the matter to be investigated if after investigation the facts indicate that such animal is a vicious animal which can include a dog or a vicious dog the chief of police shall order the person owning keeping sheltering or harboring the animal or dog in question within three days of the receipt of such order to do one of the following 1 if the animal which can include a dog is determined to be a vicious animal the person shall be required to remove it from the city or allow it to be destroyed  or 2 if the dog is not a vicious animal but nonetheless is a vicious dog the person shall be required to either license and confine the dog as required by this chapter remove the dog from the city or allow the dog to be destroyed the order from the chief of police shall be contained in a notice given to the person owning keeping sheltering or harboring the animal or dog in question the notice shall also set forth the description of the animal or dog in question and the basis for the allegation of viciousness the notice shall also state that the person has three days from the date the notice was received to file a written notice of appeal with the city clerk contesting the determination by the chief of police failure to file such written notice of appeal constitutes a waiver of right to appeal the order the order and notice shall be served by a city police officer personally upon any adult residing at the premises where the animal is located or may be posted on those premises if no adult is present to accept service or may be mailed to the person by certified mail if the order is not complied with within three days of its issuance and no appeal has been filed with the city clerk the chief of police or his designee is authorized to seize and impound the animal or dog an animal or dog so seized shall be impounded for a period of seven days if at the end of the impoundment period the person against whom the order was issued has not complied with the order the chief of police or his designee shall cause the animal or dog to be destroyed in a humane manner b the order of the chief of police may be appealed to the city council if written notice of appeal is filed with the city clerk within three days after receipt of the order contained in the notice the notice of appeal shall state the grounds for such appeal and shall be delivered personally or by certified mail to the city clerk the hearing of such appeal shall be scheduled within twenty days of the receipt of notice of appeal the person requesting the hearing shall be given not less than seventytwo hours written notice of the time and place of the hearing the notice shall be served by a city police officer personally upon the person or shall be served by certified mail the hearing may be continued for good cause after such hearing the city council may affirm or reverse the order of the chief of police such determination shall be contained in a written decision and shall be filed with the city clerk within three days after the hearing or any continued session thereof if the city council affirms the action of the chief of police the council shall order in its written decision that the person owning sheltering harboring or keeping the animal or dog in question shall within three days of the receipt of such order do one of the following 1 if the animal including a dog is determined to be a vicious animal the person shall be required to remove it from the city or allow it to be destroyed  or 2 if the dog is not a vicious animal but nonetheless is a vicious dog the person shall be required to either license and confine the dog as required by this chapter remove the dog from the city or allow the dog to be destroyed the city councils decision and order shall immediately be served upon the person against whom rendered by having a city police officer personally serve the person or serve the person by sending the decision and order by certified mail if the order is not complied with within three days of its issuance the chief of police or his designee is authorized to seize and impound the animal or dog an animal or dog so seized shall be impounded for a period of seven days if at the end of the impoundment period the individual or entity against whom the order of the city council was issued has not petitioned the county district court for a review of such order and provided a copy of the petition to the city clerk or has not complied with the order the chief of police or his designee shall cause the animal or dog to be destroyed in a humane manner c failure to comply with an order of the chief of police or his designee issued pursuant hereto and not appealed or of the city council and not successfully appealed is a misdemeanor d any animal or dog which is alleged to be vicious and which is under impoundment or quarantine at the animal shelter shall not be released to the owner but shall continue to be held at the expense of the owner pending the outcome of the hearing all costs of such impoundment or quarantine shall be paid by the owner if the animal or dog is determined to be vicious if the animal or dog is not determined to be vicious all costs of such impoundment or quarantine shall be paid by the city added during 1988 codification   vicious animals or dogsdestruction authorized when any animal or dog found at large which displays vicious tendencies may be processed as a vicious animal pursuant to this chapter unless the animal or dog is so vicious that it cannot safely be apprehended in which case the chief of police or his designee is authorized to immediately destroy it added during 1988 codification   cruelty to animals prohibited it is unlawful for a person to torture torment deprive of necessary sustenance mutilate overdrive overload drive when overloaded cruelly beat cruelly kill any animal or unnecessarily fail to provide the same with proper food drink shelter or protection from the weather or drive or work the same when unfit for labor or cruelly abandon the same or carry the same or cause the same to be cruelly carried on any vehicle or otherwise or to commit any other act or omission by which unjustifiable pain distress suffering or death is caused or permitted to any animal whether the acts or omissions herein contemplated be committed either maliciously wilfully or negligently added during 1988 codification   livestock it is unlawful for a person to keep within the city livestock except where the keeping of such livestock is permitted under the zoning as amended this restriction shall not apply to livestock shows or auction sales at approved sites so long as such does not constitute a nuisance added during 1988 codification   abandoned animals it is unlawful for any owner or other person to abandon turn loose or leave any animal within the corporate limits of the city or so that the animal may find its way into the corporate limits of the city or to abandon or leave any animal upon or in any premise amended during 1988 codification prior code  3   keeping vicious dogssignpostingtime restrictions any person who owns shelters harbors or keeps a vicious dog within the city shall within ten days of the effective date of the ordinance codified in this chapter display in a prominent place on their premises a sign easily readable by the public using the words beware of dog in addition a similar sign is required to be posted on the kennel or pen of such animal amended during 1988 codification prior code  3   animals running at large unlawful no owner of any animal shall permit such animal to run at large within the corporate limits of the city  1992 amended during 1988 codification prior code  3   interference or destruction of adjoining property it is unlawful for the owner of any animal to allow or permit such animal to pass upon the premises of another thereby causing damage to or interference with the premises amended during 1988 codification prior code  3   annoyance or disturbance it is unlawful for the owner of a dog to allow or permit such dog to cause annoyance or disturbance to any person by threatening howling yelping barking growling or otherwise creating a disturbance  or by running after or chasing persons bicycles automobiles or other vehicles or other animals amended during 1988 codification prior code  3   release of animals in confinement unlawful no person shall aid or cause any animal whether owned by such person or not to escape confinement or impoundment whether such confinement or impoundment be upon such persons property or that of another by opening any gate door or window by making an opening in any fence enclosure or structure or by unleashing such animal amended during 1988 codification prior code  3   sanitary requirements and responsibilities it is unlawful for any person owning controlling or caring for any animal to fail to keep in a clean and sanitary condition the premises and any pen kennel shelter house or persons dwelling or other structure where the animal is at any time kept at least once every twentyfour hours or more often if odors or health problems arise such person shall pick up any and all feces so as to prevent its accumulation and same shall be properly disposed of feces shall be held in watertight and flytight containers pending disposal and shall be disposed of at least once weekly the animal and place where the animal is maintained shall also be kept free of obnoxious odors and shall be maintained so as not to attract or permit the harborage or breeding of flies and other insects or rodents or other vermin all animal food and water shall be stored and placed for the animals consumption in such a manner so that it will not become food for rodents and other vermin amended during 1988 codification prior code  3   animals running at largeimpoundment authorized when a animals found at large in violation of this chapter and animals that are not properly licensed immunized or tagged in accordance with this chapter shall be seized and impounded or at the discretion of the police officer the owner may be served a summons to appear before a proper court to answer charges pursuant to this chapter b if the owners name and address appear on an animals collar or are otherwise known the owner shall be notified within two days from impoundment that upon payment of an impounding fee of twentyfive dollars for the first violation and fifty dollars for each subsequent violation plus cost of food and care in a reasonable amount the animal will be returned the notice given to the owner may be orally given by a police officer personally served by a police officer or sent by ordinary mail to the owners last known address notice shall be deemed completed when the owner is orally notified given the written notice or when the notice is mailed if impounded licensed animals are not recovered by their owners within seven days after notice the animals shall be disposed of in a humane manner if disposition of any animal is accomplished the city shall retain the net sales price as its cost of impounding and disposition c when the owners of seized and impounded animals cannot be identified because the animals are not wearing licensed tags or some other type of identification tags notice to the owner shall not be required all owners of animals shall be personally responsible to appear at the citys designated pound immediately after the disappearance of their animals in order to determine whether their animals have been seized or impounded impounded unlicensed dogs or other animals may be recovered by the owner upon proper identification by payment of the impounding fee of twentyfive dollars for the first violation and fifty dollars for each subsequent violation and boarding costs in addition the owner of any unlicensed dog must also show the appropriate license for such dog  provided however that if the owner has fulfilled all of the requirements to have an impounded dog licensed except the animal has not received the required vaccination then upon such showing the police department official may after payment of the required fees release such dog upon the condition that the dog is vaccinated by a licensed veterinarian within twentyfour hours of such release and that a certificate of such vaccination is furnished to the police department official it shall be the duty of the police department official to ascertain the name and address of the veterinarian to which such dog will be taken by the owner for vaccination and to make it known to the police department if proof of such vaccination is not furnished within three days after the conditional release of the dog to the owner  and if proof of vaccination is not provided within three days the police department may immediately pick up and impound such dog if unlicensed dogs or other animals are not claimed within seven days after impoundment they shall be disposed of in a humane manner if disposition of an animal is accomplished sale the city shall retain the net sales price as its cost of impounding and disposition d in the event the provisions of this chapter which outlines the seizure impoundment and disposition of dangerous animals or sets forth the seizure impoundment and disposition of vicious animals and vicious dogs should be in conflict with the provisions of this section shall supersede and take precedence over any of the provisions contained in this section  1992  amended during 1988 codification prior code  3   interference with enforcement officials it shall be prohibited for any person in any manner to interfere with any employee or designated representative of the city so as to hinder delay or prevent his executing his duties in relation to the matters and things contained in this chapter amended during 1988 codification prior code  3   suspected rabies carriersquarantine the owner of any animal capable of causing rabies shall report at once to the chief of police the fact that his animal has bitten a person or an animal which is capable of causing rabies and all persons having knowledge of such fact should thusly report the same it shall be the duty of the chief of police to order the owner of any dog or other animal capable of causing rabies which has bitten a person or another animal capable of causing rabies or any dog or animal suspected of being infected with rabies to confine such dog or animal for a period of fourteen days at a veterinary clinic or a registered kennel the health officer may allow a dog or animal capable of causing rabies which has bitten a person or another animal capable of causing rabies and which is either probably under six months old or has a current certificate of inoculation for rabies to remain in quarantine for that period on the property of the owner so long as the dog is there confined and out of contact with members of the public or other animals during the quarantine period such home quarantine shall not be allowed where there is a reasonable belief that the dogs or animals condition requires observation at a veterinary clinic or a registered kennel where the dog or animal does not remain in quarantine in the manner prescribed by the health officer for the fourteenday period the animal or dog shall be apprehended and impounded for fourteen days if the dog or animal is claimed by the owner after the fourteenday period the owner shall pay for the cost of confinement if the dog or animal is not claimed after the fourteenday period the dog or animal may be disposed of in a humane manner amended during 1988 codification prior code  3   animal waste it is unlawful for any person owning controlling or caring for any animal to permit said animal to excrete solid waste material upon any public or private property within the city limits other than the property of the owner of the animal unless said solid waste material is immediately thereafter removed from the public or private property and disposed of in a sanitary manner this section shall not apply to animals properly trained and certified to assist persons with disabilities while such animals are acting in such capacity  2002   violationpenalty a an owner of an animal who violates any of the provision of this chapter shall upon conviction be guilty of a simple misdemeanor b a violation of any portion of this chapter shall be a municipal infraction unless the violation would be a felony or a serious misdemeanor or aggravated misdemeanor under the laws of the state of iowa c violators may be subject to other appropriate remedies such as court orders to abate andor halt the violations  2002 deer feeding regulations prohibition on feeding deer no person shall engage in the artificial feeding of deer within the city limits of algona except as set forth in this chapter artificial feeding shall be defined as the placement of shelled corn andor other types of grain salt or minerals fruit or vegetable matter on the ground or in feeders mangers or any other type of structure or receptacle for the purpose of feeding or attracting deer on any private or public property  part 2006   exceptions the prohibition set forth in this chapter shall not apply to any of the following a use of bird feeders or their equivalent for the primary purpose of feeding of birds b cultivation of naturally growing grains fruits or vegetables for purposes other than the feeding of deer but which inadvertently attract deer  part 2006 title 8  health and safety burglar and fire alarm systems definitions for the purpose of this chapter the following words and phrases shall be construed to have the meanings set forth unless it is apparent from the context that a different meaning is intended a alarm business means the business of selling leasing maintaining inspecting servicing repairing replacing altering moving or installing any alarm system b alarm system means either a fire burglar or holdup alarm system c burglar alarm system means a system of detecting and signalling the presence entry or attempted entry of an intruder into protected premises d central alarm system means a system installed maintained and operated by an alarm business by which all alarms are transmitted to and received by one receiver located at the police station e fire alarm system means a method of detecting and signalling the presence of fire the products of combustion or heat in a protected premises f protected premises means that part of a building to which protection is afforded by an alarm system 1   connection to central systemrequired when all alarms presently existing or hereinafter installed for which a permit is required shall be connected to the central alarm system expense of installing maintaining and operating each alarm in the system shall be paid by the owner or the person controlling the protected premises 1   permitrequired no person shall have or maintain at premises under his control or ownership an alarm system in the absence of a currently valid alarm system permit issued pursuant to the provisions of this chapter 1   alarm systems exempt from regulations no alarm system permit is required if an alarm signal is transmitted only to the residence of the person in control of or owning the protected premises or the residence of someone who is his regular employee or if it is audible at the protected premises 1   permitapplication application for permits shall be filed with the chief of police on forms provided for that purpose 1   chief of policeauthority to impose regulations the chief of police may propose regulations prescribing minimum standards for the construction maintenance and operation of fire burglar and holdup alarm systems and requiring inspection and approval of all such systems he shall consult with the fire chief on standards for fire alarm systems such standards shall have the full force and effect of law upon adoption of a resolution of approval by the council copies of these standards shall be available for inspection in the office of the chief of police 1   alarms terminating at city facilities a central control burglar or fire alarm may terminate and give a signal at the police station the police chief may set standards rules and regulations governing such equipment and may limit the number of alarm systems so terminated alarm reporting equipment in the police station shall be privately owned and the owner or lessor shall be responsible for its proper maintenance operation and repair 1   right to appealprocedures an applicant or any person firm or corporation aggrieved by a decision of the chief of police shall have the right to appeal to the council notice of appeal must be filed with the clerk within fifteen days after the decision the notice of appeal shall briefly state the basis for such appeal and shall be heard by the council at the next regular council meeting following the filing of notice of appeal 1 fireworks footnotes  1  editors note  adopted  amended ch 808 in its entirety to read as herein set out former ch 808    pertained to similar subject matter and derived from an amendment of 1988 and prior code  211 2   purpose the purpose of this chapter is to provide standards for the sales and usages of fireworks within the city all state of iowa codes for fireworks shall apply within the ordinance codified in this chapter  692017   definitions for the use of this chapter the following terms are defined consumer fireworks for purposes of this section the definition of consumer fireworks as enumerated in iowa 2 is incorporated herein by reference display fireworks for purposes of this section the definition of display fireworks as enumerated in iowa 2 is incorporated herein by reference novelties for purposes of this section the definition of novelties as enumerated in iowa 2 is incorporated herein by reference person any individual firm partnership or corporation retailer any person engaged in the business of making retail sales of consumer fireworks to the general public sales the exchange of articles of fireworks for money and also includes barter exchange gift or offer and each such transaction made by any person whether as principle proprietor salesperson agent association copartnership or one or more individuals state fire marshals permit the appropriate fireworks permit issued by the state of iowa fire marshals office  692017   permits and permit fees all sales sites shall comply with state of iowa codes and the algona municipal 1 it is unlawful for any person to sell or to offer for sale in the city of algona any item of consumer fireworks without first having secured a state fire marshals permit and a permit issued by the city of algona 2 permits issued by the city of algona are not transferable 3 permits to sell consumer fireworks from a permanent structure that meets requirements is valid only from june 1 december 10 each year all dates inclusive for a temporary structure that meets requirements the permit is valid from june 13 each year both dates inclusive 4 the city of algona fireworks permit fee is established by resolution of the algona city council 5 a permit to sell consumer fireworks in the city of algona must be issued the application shall be obtained algona fire department and shall contain the following a name address and telephone number of applicant b list physical address of sales location c the applicant shall be the natural person who will operate or be responsible for the sales d the applicant shall be the same as the name on the state fire marshals permit e acknowledgement that applicant is liable for all violations of this chapter by persons under hisher supervision f written authorization from the owner of the permanent structure or land owner of the temporary structure 6 a copy of the state fire marshals permit shall be submitted to the city of algona fire department 7 a copy of state sales tax number which has been obtained for sales tax purposes shall be submitted with the application 8 permanent structure buildings used for display and sale of consumer fireworks shall be required to have automatic fire sprinkler and fire alarm systems protection 9 no sales or display for sale of fireworks may occur on any property within the central general business district or within three hundred feet of a residential district 10 all permits and plan reviews as required by the city of algona site plan zoning or building be obtained 11 the application must contain evidence that general liability insurance has been obtained by applicant naming the city of algona as additional insured for at least two thousand dollars for each occurrence with respect to bodily injury liability and property damage liability 12 a city codes inspector shall inspect the sales site for compliance with applicable codes and ordinances before the permit by the city is issued 13 a person under the age of eighteen years shall not buy purchase acquire or obtain consumer fireworks a person shall not sell consumer fireworks to a person under the age of eighteen years and shall request a photographic id before making a sale 14 a clearly visible sign shall be posted at the display stand that states must be at least 18 years or older to purchase photo id required 15 a clearly visible sign at the display site shall be posted which states no smoking 16 fireworks may not be stored or kept near any flammable or combustible materials  692017   permit revocation the city of algona may revoke any permit upon failure of the retailer to correct any of the following violations within thirtysix hours after the retailer is given written notice by a city of algona 1 when the permittee or the permittees operator violates any lawful rule regulation or order of the city of algona 2 when the permittees application contains any false or untrue statements 3 when the permittee fails to timely file any report or pay any tax fee fine or charge 4 when the permittee or permittees operator violates any city fireworks ordinance or state of iowa statute however when any activities of the permittee constitute a distinct hazard to life or property the city of algona may revoke the permit immediately  692017   usage of fireworks within the city limits of algona it shall be unlawful for any person to use or explode any consumer or display fireworks within the city limits of algona  provided the city may upon application in writing grant a permit for the use of consumer or display fireworks by a city agency fair associations amusement parks and other organizations or groups of individuals approved by city authorities when such fireworks display will be handled by a competent operator no permit shall be granted hereunder unless the operator or sponsoring organization has filed with the city evidence of insurance in the following amounts a personal injury two hundred fifty thousand dollars per person b property damage fifty thousand dollars c total exposure one million dollars  692017   extreme fire danger during periods of extreme fire danger as determined by the fire chief or county emergency management director discharge of fireworks shall be prohibited  692017   exclusions nothing in this chapter prohibits the sale by a resident dealer manufacturer or jobber of such fireworks as are not prohibited by this chapter or state of iowa codes or the sale of any kind of fireworks if they are to be shipped out of the state or the sale or use of blank cartridges for a show or the theater or for signal purposes in athletic sports or by railroads or trucks for signal purposes or by a recognized military organization this chapter does not apply to any substance or composition prepared and sold for medicinal or fumigation purposes unless specifically provided otherwise this chapter does not apply to novelties  692017   violations and penalties any violation of any provision of this chapter is a simple misdemeanor punishable by a minimum fine of two hundred fifty dollars for the first offence and six hundred twentyfive dollars for the second and any subsequent offense  692017   seizure and disposal of fireworks the city police department may seize consumer fireworks that it has probable cause to believe are used possessed or sold in violation of this chapter and shall forfeit seized fireworks to the city fire department for disposal  692017 nuisances definitions for use in this chapter the following terms are defined a nuisance means whatever is injurious to health indecent or offensive to the senses or an obstacle to the free use of property so as essentially to interfere with the comfortable enjoyment of life or property the following are declared to be nuisances 1 offensive smells the erecting continuing or using of any building or other place for the exercise of any trade employment or manufacture which by occasioning noxious exhalations offensive smells or other annoyances becomes injurious and dangerous to the health comfort or property of individuals or the public  2 filth or noisome substance the causing or suffering any offal filth or noisome substance to be collected or to remain in any place to the prejudice of others  3 impeding passage of navigable river the obstructing or impeding without legal authority the passage of any navigable river harbor or collection of water  4 water pollution the corrupting or rendering unwholesome or impure the water of any river stream or pond or unlawfully diverting the same from its natural course or state to the injury or prejudice of others  5 blocking public and private ways the obstructing or encumbering by fences buildings or otherwise the public roads private ways streets alleys commons landing places or burying grounds  6 billboards billboards signboards and advertising signs whether erected and constructed on public or private property which so obstruct and impair the view of any portion or part of a public street avenue highway boulevard or alley or of a railroad or street railway track as to render dangerous the use thereof  7 cottonwood trees cottonbearing cottonwood trees and all other cottonbearing poplar trees  8 abandoned appliances placing or allowing to be placed any discarded abandoned unattended or unused refrigerator ice box oven or similar container equipped with an airtight door or lid snap lock or other locking device which cannot be released from the inside in a location accessible to children outside any building dwelling or within an unoccupied or abandoned building or dwelling or other structure under the control of any person without first removing the door lid snap lock or other locking device from the icebox refrigerator oven or similar container this provision applies equally to the owner of any such refrigerator ice box oven or similar container and to the owner or occupant of the premises where the hazard is permitted to remain  9 storing of inflammable junk the depositing or storing of inflammable junk such as old rags rope cordage rubber bones and paper by dealers in such articles within the fire limits of the city unless it be in a building of fireproof construction  10 air pollution the emission of dense smoke noxious fumes or fly ash  11 weeds or grasses weeds or grasses are allowed to grow to a height of eight inches on the average on real estate that is zoned bgc central general business district bn neighborhood business district hsb highway service business district mh mobile home district rs residential singlefamily district and rm residential multifamily district  twelve inches in average height on real estate that is zoned hm heavy manufacturing district and lm light manufacturing district  and eighteen inches in average height on real estate that is zoned cn conservation district and ag agricultural district any weeds or grasses taller than the abovedescribed heights are a nuisance in addition the dense growth of vines brush or other vegetation so as to constitute a health safety or fire hazard is also a nuisance this section shall not apply to prairies wellhead protection areas wetlands farm crops or other areas of naturalized perennial vegetation which can be verified by the public works director to not constitute a nuisance of health safety or fire hazard  12 dutch elm disease trees infected with dutch elm disease  13 airport air space any object or structure hereafter erected within one thousand feet of the limits of any municipal or regularly established airport or landing place which may endanger or obstruct aerial navigation including takeoff and landing unless such object or structure constitutes a proper use or enjoyment of the land on which the same is located  14 houses of ill fame houses of ill fame kept for the purpose of prostitution and lewdness gambling houses or houses resorted to for the use of opium or hashish or houses where drunkenness quarreling fighting or breaches of the peace are carried on or permitted to the disturbance of others  15 trees hedges billboards all trees hedges billboards or other obstructions which prevent persons from having a clear view of traffic approaching an intersection from cross streets in sufficient time to bring a motor vehicle driven at a reasonable speed to a full stop before the intersection is reached  16 effluent effluent from septic tank or drainfield running or ponding on the ground in the open  17 obstructions any article or substance placed upon a street alley sidewalk public ground or in any ditch waterway or gutter so as to obstruct the drainage  18 rubbish and trash accumulations of rubbish or trash tending to harbor vermin or rodents and also rank growth of weeds or other vegetation and plants which is conducive to such a hazard  19 motor vehicle used for storage a motor vehicle whether licensed or unlicensed or parts of a motor vehicle parked on private property in a residential district and used for storage of items unless said motor vehicle or parts of a motor vehicle are in an enclosed structure b property owner means the contract purchaser if there is one of record otherwise it shall mean the record holder of legal title  2003  amended during 1988 codification  prior code  3   8192013   nuisances prohibitedabatement generally the creation or maintenance of a nuisance is prohibited and a nuisance public or private may be abated in the manner provided for in this chapter or state law    abatementwritten notice required whenever the mayor or other authorized municipal officer finds that a nuisance exists he shall cause to be served upon the property owner a written notice to abate the nuisance within a reasonable time after notice    notice to abatecontents the notice to abate shall contain a description of nuisance a description of what constitutes the nuisance or other condition  b location of nuisance the location of the nuisance or condition  c acts necessary to abate a statement of the act or acts necessary to abate the nuisance or condition  d reasonable time a reasonable time within which to complete the abatement  e assessment at city costs a statement that if the nuisance or condition is not abated as directed and no request for hearing is made within the time prescribed the city will abate it and assess the costs against such person    service procedures the notice may be in the form of an ordinance may be sent by certified mail to any property owner or may be personally served upon any property owner by a city police officer  1987 prior code  3   request for hearing a any person ordered to abate a nuisance may have a hearing with the council as to whether a nuisance exists a request for a hearing must be made in writing and delivered to the clerk within the time stated in the notice or it will be conclusively presumed that a nuisance exists and it must be abated as ordered the hearing will be before the council at a time and place fixed by the council b the findings of the council shall be conclusive and if a nuisance is found to exist it shall be ordered abated within a reasonable time under the circumstances    emergency abatementassessment of costs if it is determined that an emergency exists by reason of the continuing maintenance of the nuisance or condition the city may perform any action which may be required under this chapter without prior notice the city shall assess the costs as provided in this chapter after notice to the property owner under the applicable provisions of hearing as provided in    abatement by cityauthorized when if the person notified to abate a nuisance or condition neglects or fails to abate as directed the city may perform the required action to abate keeping an accurate account of the expense incurred the itemized expense account shall be filed with the clerk who shall pay such expenses on behalf of the city    abatement by citycollection of costs the clerk shall mail a statement of the total expense incurred to the property owner who has failed to abide by the notice to abate and if the amount shown by the statement has not been paid within one month the clerk shall certify the costs to the county auditor and it shall then be collected with and in the same manner as general property taxes amended during 1988 codification  prior code  3   abatement by cityinstallment payment of cost of abatement if the amount expended to abate the nuisance or condition exceeds one hundred dollars the city shall permit the assessment to be paid in up to ten annual installments to be paid in the same manner and with the same interest as benefited property    violationfailure to abate any person causing or maintaining a nuisance who fails or refuses to abate or remove the same within the reasonable time required and specified in the notice to abate shall be in violation of this code  solid waste control collection and disposal general provisions   definitions for use in this chapter the following terms are defined 1 approved incinerator means equipment or facilities for the enclosed burning of refuse having a stack adequate to maintain a draft sufficient for efficient combustion and equipped with a screen sufficiently fine to prevent ejection of particles of burning materials as approved by the iowa air quality commission 2 back yard burning means the disposal of residential waste by open burning on the premises of the property where such waste is generated 3 discard means to place cause to be placed throw deposit or drop 4 executive director means the executive director of the state department of environmental quality or his designee 5 garbage means all solid and semisolid putrescible animal and vegetable wastes resulting from the handling preparing cooking storing serving and consuming of food or of material intended for use as food and all offal excluding useful industrial byproducts and includes all such substances from all public and private establishments and from all residences 6 landscape waste means any vegetable or plant wastes except garbage the term includes trees tree trimmings branches stumps brush weeds leaves grass shrubbery and yard trimmings 7 litter means any garbage rubbish trash refuse waste materials or debris 8 open burning means any burning of combustible materials where the products of combustion are emitted into the open air without passing chimney or stack 9 open dumping means the depositing of solid wastes on the surface of the ground or into a body or stream of water 10 owner means in addition to the record titleholder any person residing in renting leasing occupying operating or transacting business in any premises and as between such parties the duties responsibilities liabilities and obligations hereinafter imposed shall be joint and several 11 refuse means putrescible and nonputrescible wastes including but not limited to garbage rubbish ashes incinerator residues street cleanings market and industrial solid wastes and sewage treatment wastes in dry or semisolid form 12 residential waste means any refuse generated on the premises as a result of residential activities residential waste includes landscape wastes grown on the premises or deposited thereon by the elements but excludes garbage tires and trade wastes 13 rubbish means nonputrescible solid waste consisting of combustible and noncombustible wastes such as ashes paper cardboard tin cans yard clippings wood glass bedding crockery or litter of any kind 14 rubble means stone brick or similar inorganic material 15 salvage operation means any business industry or trade engaged wholly or in part in salvaging or reclaiming any product or material including but not limited to chemicals drums metals motor vehicles or shipping containers 16 sanitary disposal means a method of treating solid waste so that it does not produce a hazard to the public health or safety or create a nuisance 17 sanitary disposal project means all facilities and appurtenances including all real and personal property connected with such facilities which are acquired purchased constructed reconstructed equipped improved extended maintained or operated to facilitate the final disposition of solid waste without creating a significant hazard to the public health or safety and which are approved by the executive director 18 solid waste means garbage refuse rubbish and other similar discarded solid or semisolid materials including but not limited to such materials resulting from industrial commercial agricultural and domestic activities solid waste may include vehicles as defined by subsection 1 of of the iowa 19 toxic and hazardous wastes means waste materials including but not limited to poisons pesticides herbicides acids caustics pathological wastes flammable or explosive materials and similar harmful wastes which require special handling and which must be disposed of in such a manner as to conserve the environment and protect the public health and safety 20 yard waste means organic debris such as grass grass clippings leaves garden waste prunings weeds brush and tree branches yard waste does not include tree stumps 21 composting means a controlled microbial degradation of organic waste to produce a relatively nuisance free product of potential value as a soil conditioner or soil amendment only composting of decomposed plant material grass clippings and garden vegetable matter shall be allowed 22 bags means any bags acceptable to the composting station or used by the licensed yard waste collection hauler 23 container means a reusable receptacle constructed of plastic or metal materials 24 bundle means a stack of brush andor tree branches bound together  1991  prior code  3   intent and purpose of chapter the purpose of this chapter is to provide for the sanitary storage collection and disposal of solid wastes and thereby to protect the citizens of this city from such hazards to their health safety and welfare as may result from the uncontrolled disposal of solid wastes    accumulation constituting health hazard unlawful it is unlawful for any person to permit to accumulate on any premises improved or vacant or on any public place such quantities of solid waste either in containers or not that shall constitute a health or sanitation hazard    container storage required it is unlawful for any person to permit to accumulate quantities of solid waste within or close to any building unless the same is stored in containers in such a manner as not to create a fire hazard    open burning prohibitedexceptions no person shall allow cause or permit open burning of combustible materials except that the following shall be permitted a disaster rubbish the open burning of rubbish including landscape waste for the duration of the community disaster period in cases where an officially declared emergency condition exists  b diseased trees the open burning of diseased trees however when the burning of diseased trees causes a nuisance appropriate action may be taken to require relocation of the burning operation rubber tires shall not be used to ignite diseased trees  c flare stacks the open burning or flaring of waste gases provided such open burning or flaring is conducted in compliance with applicable rules of the state department of environmental quality  d landscape waste the disposal by open burning of landscape waste originating on the premises however the burning of landscape waste produced in clearing grubbing and construction operations shall be limited to areas located at least onefourth mile from any inhabited building rubber tires shall not be used to ignite landscape waste  e recreational fires persons residing at the property where a recreational fire is burning as well as individuals who are in charge of such recreational fire shall comply with the following 1 a recreational fire is defined as an open fire for cooking heating recreation or ceremonies provided such fire complies with the limits for emission of visible air contaminants established by the state department of environmental quality 2 all such fires must use only charcoal clean dry untreated wood natural gas or propane no processed wood such as plywood building materials or materials with paint adhesives nails or screws may be burned all untreated wood shall be no longer than three feet in length 3 all such fires shall be contained within a noncombustible device structure or fire ring designed for the purpose of containing a fire all of the devices must have adequate separation from combustibles and vegetation fires are to be kept to a small size and the flame height must always be less than three feet 4 all such fires must be attended by a competent person at all times a water source must be readily available 5 the fire chief or his designee shall have the authority to order any fire extinguished if such fire is determined to constitute a hazardous condition  f residential waste burning burning of residential waste at dwellings of four family units or less is permitted fall of 2002 as follows 1 beginning on the second to last friday in september last saturday of october each year burning shall be allowed on fridays and saturdays only from dawn to dusk 2 no burning shall be allowed on the saturday of the annual band days celebration in algona 3 no files shall ever be left unattended 4 all fires must be at least fifty feet from any structure 5 whenever burning is taking place the person attending the fire shall have a source of water nearby after the last saturday in october 200 no burning of residential waste shall be allowed in any future years  g training fires fires set for the purpose of bona fide training of public or industrial employees in fire fighting methods  provided that the executive director of the state department of environmental quality receives notice in writing at least one week before such action commences  h variance any person wishing to conduct open burning of materials not exempted in this chapter may make application for a variance to the executive director of the state department of environmental quality  2005   2000   1978  prior code  3   littering prohibited no person shall discard any litter onto or in any water or land except that nothing in this section shall be construed to affect the authorized collection and discarding of such litter in or on areas or receptacles provided for such purpose when litter is discarded from a motor vehicle the driver of the motor vehicle shall be responsible for the act in any case where doubt exists as to which occupant of the motor vehicle actually discarded the litter    open dumping unlawful no person shall dump or deposit or permit the open dumping or depositing of any solid waste except rubble at any place other than a sanitary disposal project approved by the executive director of the state department of environmental quality    toxic and hazardous waste regulations a labeling all containers used for the storage collection or transportation of toxic or hazardous wastes shall be plainly marked so as to provide adequate notice of the contents thereof b vehicles and containers all vehicles and containers used for the storage collection and transportation of toxic and hazardous wastes shall be so constructed that they can be loaded moved and unloaded in a manner that does not create a danger to public health or safety and in compliance with federal and state laws rules and regulations c disposal no person shall deposit in a solid waste container or otherwise offer for collection any toxic or hazardous wastes such materials shall be transported by the owner responsible person or his agent to a place of safe deposit or disposal as prescribed by the health officer or his authorized representative    waste storage containers requiredspecifications every person owning managing operating leasing or renting any premises dwelling unit or any place where refuse accumulates shall provide and at all times maintain in good order and repair portable containers for refuse in accordance with the following a container specification waste storage containers shall comply with the following specifications 1 residential residential waste containers shall be of not less than twenty gallons nor more than thirtyfive gallons in nominal capacity  shall be leakproof waterproof and fitted with a flytight lid which shall be kept in place except when depositing or removing the contents thereof they shall have handles bails or other suitable lifting devices or features and be of a type originally manufactured for the storage of residential wastes with tapered sides for easy emptying they shall be of light weight and sturdy construction with the total weight of any individual containers and contents not exceeding seventyfive pounds galvanized metal containers rubber or fiberglass containers and plastic containers which do not become brittle in cold weather may be used disposable containers or other containers as approved by the city may also be used 2 commercial every person owning managing operating leasing or renting any commercial premise where excessive amounts of refuse accumulate and where its storage in portable containers as required above is impractical shall maintain metal bulk storage containers approved by the city  b location of containers residential solid waste containers shall be stored upon the residential premises commercial solid waste containers shall be stored upon private property unless the owner shall have been granted written permission from the city to use public property for such purposes the storage site shall be well drained  fully accessible to collection equipment public health personnel and fire inspection personnel  c nonconforming containers solid waste containers which are not adequate will be collected together with their contents and disposed of after due notice to the owner    separation of yard wastes required all yard wastes shall be separated by the owner or occupant from all other solid waste accumulated on the premises the owner or occupant may either compost their yard waste on the premises or contain it in authorized bags containers or bundles  1991   yard waste storage owners or occupants choosing not to manage yard waste on their own property shall contain yard waste in authorized bags containers or bundles so as to prevent the dispersal of wastes placed therein upon the premises served upon adjacent premises or upon adjacent public rightsofway a licensed collector may specify the type of collection receptacle an owner or occupant must use before said collector is required to pick up the yard waste the number of authorized bags container or bundles containing yard waste which residents may place out for collection shall be unlimited tree limbs less than four inches in diameter and brush shall be securely tied in bundles not larger than fortyeight inches long and eighteen inches in diameter when not placed in storage containers the weight of any individual bundle bag or container shall not exceed seventyfive pounds  1991   composting owners and occupants who engage in composting shall accumulate upon property under their control such quantities of leaves andor yard debris from their own property as can be properly composted without creating offensive odors a nuisance litter or fire problems such composting so carried out shall be deemed to be an alternative disposition of the disposal of yard waste in satisfaction of any requirement to separate yard waste the kossuth county extension service can be contacted to determine what is considered suitable composting  1991   sanitary disposal required it shall be the duty of each owner to provide for the sanitary disposal of all refuse accumulating on his premises before it becomes a nuisance any such accumulation remaining on any premises for a period of more than thirty days shall be deemed a nuisance and the city may proceed to abate such nuisances in accordance with the provisions of of this title or by initiating proper action in district court    unlawful acts designated it is unlawful for any person to a unlawful use of containers deposit refuse in any solid waste containers other than his own without the written consent of the owner of such containers  b interfere with collectors interfere in any manner with solid waste collection equipment or with solid waste collectors in the lawful performance of their duties as such whether such equipment or collectors be those of the city or those of any other authorized waste collection service  c unlawful disposal dispose of refuse at any facility or location which is not an approved sanitary disposal project  d unlawful collection engage in the business of collecting transporting processing or disposing of refuse within the city without a contract therefor with the city or a valid permit therefor  e incinerators burn rubbish or garbage except in approved incinerators so maintained and operated as to prevent the emission of objectionable odors or particulate matter f unlawful combination of yard waste and solid waste put into the solid waste collection system of the city any yard waste this prohibition applies to any owner lessee or occupant of any residential commercial or institutional property in the city  1991  prior code  3   punishment of violators a violation of any other section of by any person shall be a misdemeanor and upon conviction will carry a fine of not more than one hundred dollars or imprisonment not to exceed thirty days  1991 collection and transportation   definitions for for use in this article the following terms are defined a collectors means any person authorized by this article to gather solid waste or yard waste from public and private places b property served means any property which is being used or occupied and is eligible to receive solid waste or yard waste collection and disposal service as provided herein  part 1991  prior code  3   collectionauthority the collection of solid waste or yard waste within the city shall be only by collectors licensed by the city  part 1991  prior code  3   collectionvehicle regulations vehicles or containers used for the collection and transportation of garbage and similar putrescible waste or solid waste containing such materials shall be leakproof durable and of easily cleanable construction they shall be cleaned to prevent nuisances pollution or insect breeding and shall be maintained in good repair    collectionmethod vehicles or containers used for the collection and transportation of any solid waste or yard waste shall be loaded and moved in such a manner that the contents will not fall leak or spill therefrom and shall be covered to prevent blowing or loss of material where spillage does occur the material shall be picked up immediately by the collector or transporter and returned to the vehicle or container and the area properly cleaned  part 1991  prior code  3   collectionfrequency all solid waste shall be collected from residential premises at least once each week and from commercial industrial and institutional premises as frequently as may be necessary but not less than once each week all yard waste shall be collected from residential commercial industrial and institutional premises at least once each month during the months of march june july august september and december all yard waste shall be collected at least twice each month during the months of april may october and november  1991  prior code  3   container location and placement location of containers containers for the storage of solid waste or yard waste awaiting collection shall be placed outofdoors at some easily accessible place by the owner or occupant of the premises served  part 1991  prior code  3   bulky rubbish bulky rubbish which is too large or heavy to be collected in the normal manner of other solid waste may be collected by the collector at his discretion    tree limbs and brush tree limbs of less than four inches in diameter and brush will be collected provided they are placed at the curb or alley line securely tied in bundles not more than fortyeight inches long or eighteen inches in diameter when not in approved containers and weigh no more than seventyfive pounds    yard wastes yard wastes will be collected provided they are stored in authorized bags containers or bundles so as to prevent the dispersal of wastes placed therein upon the premises served upon adjacent premises or upon adjacent public rightsofway a licensed collector may specify the type of collection receptacle an owner or occupant must use before said collector is required to pick up the yard waste the weight of any individual bag container or bundle shall not exceed seventyfive pounds  1991   right of entryauthoritylimitations solid waste collectors are authorized to enter upon private property for the purpose of collecting solid waste or yard waste therefrom as required by this article however solid waste collectors shall not enter dwelling units or other residential buildings  part 1991  prior code  3   collectors license required no person shall engage in the business of collecting transporting processing or disposing of solid waste or yard waste other than his own within the city without first obtaining from the city an annual license in accordance with the following a application application for a solid waste or yard waste collectors license shall be made to the clerk and provide the following 1 name and address the full name and address of the applicant and if a corporation the names and addresses of the officers thereof 2 equipment a complete and accurate listing of the number and type of collection and transportation equipment to be used 3 collection program a complete description of the frequency routes and method of collection and transportation to be used 4 disposal a statement as to the precise location and method of disposal or processing facilities to be used a yard waste collection hauler shall provide the city a detailed description of the manner in which the collector intends to separately collect and haul away yard waste each licensed collector shall haul the yard waste to an appropriate disposal location and shall keep an accurate accounting of the amount of such yard waste each licensed collector shall submit an annual written report to the city detailing the amount of such yard waste that has been collected and delivered for composting during each month of the reporting year a licensed collector shall not mix yard waste and solid waste together the license of any hauler who delivers for disposal yard waste and solid waste mixed together may be revoked the city administrator shall determine whether the license will be revoked if it is revoked the hauler may appeal the decision
