marked for angle parking no person shall park or stand a vehicle other than at an angle to the curb or edge of the roadway or in the center of the roadway as indicated by such signs and markings no part of any vehicle or the load thereon when parked within a diagonal parking district shall extend into the roadway more than a distance of sixteen feet when measured at right angles to the adjacent curb or edge of roadway 1   unlawful acts designated no person shall park a vehicle upon the roadway for any of the following principal purposes 1 displaying such vehicle for sale  2 for commercial washing greasing or repairing such vehicle except such repairs as are necessitated by an emergency  3 displaying advertising  4 selling merchandise from such vehicle except in a duly established market place or when so authorized or licensed under the city code  5 storage or as junkage or dead storage for more than fortyeight hours 1   stopping standing or parkinginterfering with public ways no one shall stop stand or park a vehicle except when necessary to avoid conflict with other traffic or in compliance with the directions of a peace officer or trafficcontrol device in any of the following places 1 crosswalk on a crosswalk at an intersection  2 center parkway on the center parkway or dividing area of any divided street  3 mailboxes within twenty feet on either side of a mailbox which is so placed and so equipped as to permit the depositing of mail from vehicles on the roadway  4 sidewalks on or across a sidewalk  5 driveway in front of a public or private driveway  6 intersection within or within ten feet of an intersection of any street or alley  7 fire hydrant within five feet of a fire hydrant  8 stop sign or signal within ten feet upon the approach to any flashing beacon stop or yield sign or trafficcontrol signal located at the side of a roadway  9 railroad crossing within fifty feet of the nearest rail of a railroad crossing except when parked parallel with such rail and not exhibiting a red light  10 fire station within twenty feet of the driveway entrance to any fire station and on the side of a street opposite the entrance to any fire station within seventyfive feet of the entrance when properly sign posted  11 excavations alongside or opposite any street excavation or obstruction when such stopping standing or parking would obstruct traffic  12 double parking on the roadway side of any vehicle stopped or parked at the edge or curb of a street  13 hazardous locations when because of restricted visibility or when standing or parked vehicles would constitute a hazard to moving traffic or when other traffic conditions require the chief of police may cause curbings to be painted with a yellow color and erect no parking or standing signs  14 theatres hotels and auditoriums a space of fifty feet is reserved at the side of the street in front of any theatre auditorium hotel having more than twentyfive sleeping rooms hospital nursing home taxicab stand bus depot church or other building where large assemblages of people are being held within which space when clearly marked as such no motor vehicle shall be left standing parked or stopped except in taking on or discharging passengers or freight and then only for such length of time as is necessary for such purpose  15 controlled access facility approach on of the city which are zoned for residential use only when actually receiving or delivering merchandise or cargo such vehicle shall be stopped or parked in a manner which will not interfere with other corporation or association or any agent or employee thereof to park or leave standing any vehicle motor driven or otherwise within the parking lots owned or leased by the city at any time for a period of time in excess of twentyfour continuous hours a police officer is authorized to remove or cause to be removed such vehicle parked or left standing in such municipal lot for a period of time in excess of twentyfour continuous hours provided a diligent effort shall first be made to locate the owner and if found he shall be given an opportunity to remove the vehicle in addition to the standard penalties provided the owner of such impounded vehicle shall be required to pay the reasonable cost of towing and storage  1979 prior code  21 part   parks and recreational areas no person shall park parking space on the south side of call street east of the intersection with minnesota street  1991   1986 prior code  21   parking during times when a snow emergency has been declaredimpoundment and other penalties authorized except for physicians on emergency calls or drivers of emergency vehicles it is unlawful for any person to park abandon or leave unoccupied or unattended any vehicle on a public street if a snow emergency has been declared by the city street superintendent the director of public works the chief of police or a designee of any of the foregoing offices the declaration of a snow emergency shall be provided by means of a public service announcement on the local radio station covering the city once a snow emergency has been declared then all vehicles must be removed from any public street once the time of the snow emergency goes into effect the vehicles must be removed even if no snow has fallen the snow emergency shall remain in effect until snow removal has been completed or the snow emergency is terminated by announcement of the city the snow emergency may be extended if additional declarations are made by the city as previously set forth in this section a violation of this section is a scheduled violation and subject to a fine of twentyfive dollars admitted violations may be charged upon a simple notice of a fine of twentyfive dollars payable at the office of the city clerk if such fine is not paid within three business days a complaint may be filed as provided by the code of iowa the scheduled fine shall be increased by five dollars if it is not paid within thirty days of the date upon which the violation occurred in the event any vehicle is in violation of this section any police officer of the city is authorized to remove or cause to be removed or to tow or to have towed or otherwise remove such vehicle to such place as the chief of police may from time to time direct in addition to the standard penalty provided in of this municipal code the owner of such impounded vehicle shall be required to pay the reasonable cost of towing and storage it is unlawful for any person to reclaim the vehicle so removed and stored without first paying the reasonable cost of towing and storage the police department shall have complete discretion as to whether a scheduled violation is issued to a vehicle in violation of this section or if the vehicle is towed  2006   signposting required for restricted areas whenever by this chapter or any other section of the municipal code any parking time limit is imposed or parking is prohibited on designated streets or portions of streets it shall be the duty of the police chief to erect or cause to be erected appropriate signs giving notice thereof and no such regulations shall be effective unless signs are erected and in place at the time of any alleged offense when the signs are so erected giving notice thereof no person shall disobey the restrictions stated on such signs 1   loadingunloading parkingareas designated parking for loading and unloading only shall be provided for in the following designated areas 1 the paved area of parking located within the street rightofway on the south side of overmeyer drive located west of thorington street and north of the bathhouse at the algona aquatic center vehicles using this parking area for loading or unloading shall not be parked there for longer than five minutes the area designated for loading and unloading shall be allowed even though the rest of the south side of overmeyer drive is a no parking zone 2 the seventh perpendicular parking space south of nebraska street on the east side of smith street which space is located west of the entrance to maple park apartments vehicles using this parking area for loading or unloading shall not be parked there for longer than 15 minutes  2001   2001   1999  862012 controlled access facilities   purpose and intent this chapter shall be deemed an exercise of the police power of the city under iowa 197 for the preservation of the public peace health safety and for the promotion of the general welfare    controlled access facility defined the term controlled access facility means a highway or street especially designed for over from or to which owners or occupants of abutting land or other persons have no right or easement or only a controlled right of easement of access light air or view by reason of the fact that their property abuts upon such controlledaccess facility or for any other reason    right of access limited no person shall have any right of ingress or egress to from or across any controlled access facility except at such points as may be permitted by the iowa highway commission and designated by ordinance    access controls imposed on us no 18 and us no 169 there are fixed and established controlled access facilities on the primary road system extension improvement project nos u 1116 and f 1405 primary road nos 18 and 169 within the addition 783 + 75 drive southt private lot 2 block 14 calls addition  2 1994  prior code  8 abandoned vehicles   definitions for use in this chapter the following terms are defined a abandoned vehicle means any of the following 1 a vehicle that has been left unattended on public property for more than fortyeight hours and lacks current registration plates or two or more wheels or other parts which renders the vehicle inoperable  or 2 a vehicle that has remained illegally on public property for more than seventytwo hours  or 3 a vehicle that has been unlawfully parked on private property or has been placed on private property without the consent of the owner or person in control of the property for more than twentyfour hours  or 4 a vehicle that has been legally impounded by order of the police department and has not been reclaimed for a period of ten days  or 5 any vehicle parked upon a street determined by the police department to create a hazard or obstruction to other vehicle traffic if the owner or operator of a vehicle is unable to move the vehicle notifies the police department of his problem and requests assistance in the removal of the vehicle then a vehicle shall not be considered abandoned for a period of fifteen days from the date the police were notified b department means the police department of the city of algona iowa c private property means any real property within the city which is not public property as defined in this section d public roperty means any public rightofway open for the purposes of vehicular travel e vehicle means every device in upon or by which a person or property is or may be transported or drawn upon a highway or street excepting devices moved by human power or used exclusively upon stationary rails or tracks and shall include without limitation a motor vehicle automobile truck trailer motorcycle tractor buggy wagon farm machinery or any combination thereof added during 1988 codification   impoundmentauthority the department may without prior notice or hearing remove and impound any abandoned vehicle on public property and any abandoned vehicle on private property the department may employ city personnel equipment and facilities or hire other personnel equipment and facilities for the purpose of removing preserving storing or disposing abandoned vehicles nothing in this chapter shall govern the procedures of any police officer in taking into custody and impounding any vehicle to be used or proposed to be used as evidence in a criminal case involving crimes other than violations of this chapter added during 1988 codification   impoundmentnotification of owners and lienholders a when a vehicle is taken into custody under the provisions of this chapter or under any provisions of state law the department shall notify within twenty days by certified mail the last known registered owner of the vehicle all lienholders of record and any other known claimant to the vehicle or to personal property found in the vehicle addressed to their last known addresses of record that the abandoned vehicle has been taken into custody notice shall be deemed given when mailed the notice shall describe the year make model and serial number of the vehicle describe the personal property found in the vehicle set forth the location of the facility where the vehicle is being held and inform the persons receiving the notice of their right to reclaim the vehicle and personal property within twentyone days after the effective date of the notice upon payment of all towing preservation and storage charges resulting from placing the vehicle in custody and upon payment of the costs of notice required pursuant to this section the notice shall also state that the failure of the owner or lienholders to exercise their right to reclaim the vehicle within the time provided shall be deemed a waiver by the owner and all lienholders of all right title claim and interest in the vehicle and that failure to reclaim the vehicle is deemed consent to the sale of the vehicle at a public auction or disposal of the vehicle to a demolisher the notice shall state that any person claiming rightful possession of the vehicle or personal property who disputes the planned disposition of the vehicle or property by the department or of the assessment of fees and charges provided by this section may ask for a hearing before the city administrator to contest those matters the notice shall also state that a request for a hearing must be in writing and received by the department prior to the expiration of the twentyoneday reclaiming period in addition the notice shall state that in the event a hearing is requested immediate release of the vehicle may be obtained by posting a cash bond in an amount equal to the sum of the impoundment fee towing charges preservation charges storage charges and notice charges if the persons receiving the notice do not ask for a hearing or do not exercise their right to reclaim the vehicle within the twentyoneday reclaiming period the owner and lienholders shall no longer have any right title claim or interest in or to the vehicle no court in any case in law or equity shall recognize any right title claim or interest of the owner and lienholders after the expiration of the twentyoneday reclaiming period b if the identity of the last registered owner cannot be determined or if the registration contains no address for the owner or if it is impossible to determine with reasonable certainty the identity and addresses of all lienholders notice by one publication in one newspaper of general circulation in the area where the vehicle was abandoned shall be sufficient to meet all requirements of notice under this section the published notice may contain multiple listings of abandoned vehicles but shall be published within the same time requirements and contain the same information as prescribed for mailed notice in this section c the owner or any lienholders may by written request delivered to the department prior to the expiration of the twentyoneday reclaiming period obtain an additional fourteen days within which the vehicle may be reclaimed added during 1988 codification   impoundmentfees before the owner or other person lawfully entitled to possession of any vehicle that has been impounded under the provisions of this chapter or any other provision of law may recover such vehicle such person shall present to the department evidence of such persons identity and right to possession of the vehicle shall sign a receipt for its return and shall pay the costs of a an impoundment fee of ten dollars if claimed within five days of impounding plus one dollar for each additional day within the reclaiming period  and b towing charges  and c preservation charges  and d storage charges  and e notice charges added during 1988 codification   impoundmenthearing a the registered owner or any lienholder of record may object to the legality of the impoundment or the assessment of fees and request a hearing thereon request for a hearing after an impoundment shall be made in writing and received by the department prior to the expiration of the twentyoneday reclaiming period no person shall be entitled to more than one hearing on each impoundment after requesting a hearing the objector shall be informed of the reason for the impoundment and a hearing shall be held without unnecessary delay before a hearing officer who shall be the city administrator upon request of the objector the hearing may be set for a later time and date however the new date shall be no later than twenty days after the original hearing date b at the hearing the hearing officer shall consider the objection make a decision as to the legality of the impoundment and immediately notify the objector in writing of the decision the decision shall state either of the following 1 that impoundment is authorized by law an explanation for the basis of that decision and an itemization of the charges assessed pursuant to this chapter any bond posted shall be applied to the satisfaction of the charges itemized by the hearing officer  2 that impoundment is not authorized by law and if the vehicle has been impounded that the vehicle will be released to the objector upon the objector presenting to the department evidence of such persons identity and right to possession of the vehicle and after the objector signs a receipt for its return all costs of removal preservation storage and notification accruing fourth day after the hearing officers decision are waived and will be paid by the city all costs accruing thereafter shall be paid prior to recovery of the vehicle any bond posted shall be refunded c the decision of the hearing officer shall be final d failure of the objector to appear at the scheduled hearing shall constitute a waiver of the right to a hearing and the bond shall be forfeited e the only issue to be considered at the hearing shall be the validity of the determination that the vehicle is an abandoned vehicle the hearing will not be determinative of or adjudicate any outstanding or unsettled traffic violation notice or warrant added during 1988 codification   auction or disposalstate statutes adopted the department shall follow the procedures in state law for the auction or disposal of abandoned vehicles added during 1988 codification   limitation on liability no person firm corporation unit of government garage keeper or police authority upon whose property an abandoned vehicle is found or who disposes of such abandoned vehicle in accordance with this chapter or the applicable state law shall be liable for damages by reason of the removal sale or disposal of such vehicle  part 1991   penalty for abandonment any person who abandons a vehicle shall be guilty of a simple misdemeanor  part 1991 bicycles skateboards and scooters bicycle licensing   licenserequired no person who resides within the city shall ride or propel a bicycle on any street or upon any public path set aside for the exclusive use of bicycles unless such bicycle has been licensed and a license decal is attached thereto as provided herein  part 1984 prior code  211   licenseapplication application for a bicycle license and license decal shall be made upon a form provided by the city and shall be made to the chief of police a license fee of two dollars shall be paid to the city before each license is granted  part 1984 prior code  212   licenseissuance the chief of police upon receiving proper application therefor is authorized to issue a bicycle license which shall be effective immediately  part 1984 prior code  213   transfer of ownership upon the sale or other transfer of a licensed bicycle the licensee shall remove the license decal  part 1984 prior code  214   licenseterm all licenses issued hereunder shall be valid for as long as the applicant retains ownership of the bicycle licensed hereunder transfer of ownership or possession of a bicycle licensed hereunder shall render such license void  part 1984 prior code  215   license plates or decalsissuance the chief of police upon issuing a bicycle license shall also issue a license plate or decal bearing the license number assigned to the bicycle and the name of the city  part 1984 prior code  211   license plates or decalsattachment to bicycle the chief of police shall cause such license plate or decal to be firmly attached to the bicycle for which issued in such position as to be plainly visible from the rear  part 1984 prior code  212   license plates or decalsremoval unlawful no person shall remove a license plate or decal from a bicycle during the period for which issued except upon a transfer of ownership or in the event the bicycle is dismantled and no longer operated upon any street in the city  part 1984 prior code  213   recordkeeping responsibilities the chief of police shall keep a record of the number of each license the date issued the name and address of the person to whom issued and the number on the frame of the bicycle for which issued and a record of all bicycle license fees collected by him 1   rental agencieslicensing and equipment regulations a rental agency shall not rent or offer any bicycle for rent unless the bicycle is licensed and a license plate is attached thereto as provided herein and such bicycle is equipped with the lamps and other equipment required in this chapter 1 bicycle regulations   scope of regulations these regulations shall apply whenever a bicycle is operated upon any street or upon any public path set aside for the exclusive use of bicycles subject to those exceptions stated herein 1   signal device required no person shall operate a bicycle unless it is equipped with a bell or other device capable of giving a signal audible for a distance of at least one hundred feet except that a bicycle shall not be equipped with nor shall any person use upon a bicycle any siren or whistle 12   brakes required every bicycle shall be equipped with a brake which will enable the operator to make the braked wheel skid on dry level clean pavement 13   nighttime use every bicycle shall be equipped with a lamp on the front exhibiting a white light at any time from sunset to sunrise visible from a distance of at least three hundred feet to the front and with a lamp on the rear exhibiting a red light visible from a distance of three hundred feet to the rear  except that a red reflector meeting the requirements of of the iowa 198 may be used in lieu of a rear light amended during 1988 codification prior code  211   parking no person shall park a bicycle upon a street other than upon the roadway against the curb or upon the sidewalk in a rack to support the bicycle or against a building or at the curb in such a manner as to afford the least obstruction to pedestrian traffic 1   observance of traffic regulations every person riding a bicycle upon a roadway shall be granted all of the rights and shall be subject to all of the duties applicable to the driver of a vehicle by the laws of the state declaring rules of the road applicable to vehicles or by the traffic code of this city applicable to the driver of a vehicle except as to those provisions which by their nature can have no application whenever such person dismounts from a bicycle he shall be subject to all regulations applicable to pedestrians 11   riding on bicycles a person propelling a bicycle shall not ride other than astride a permanent and regular seat attached thereto no bicycle shall be used to carry more persons at one time than the number for which it is designed and equipped 12   riding abreast persons riding bicycles upon a roadway shall not ride more than two abreast except on paths or parts of roadways set aside for the exclusive use of bicycles 13   use of bicycle paths required whenever a usable path for bicycles has been provided adjacent to a roadway bicycle riders shall use such path and shall not use the roadway 14   speed restrictions no person shall operate a bicycle at a speed greater than is reasonable and prudent under the conditions then existing 15   emerging from alleys or driveways the operators of a bicycle emerging from an alley driveway or building shall upon approaching a sidewalk or the sidewalk area extending across any alleyway yield the rightofway to all pedestrians approaching on such sidewalk or sidewalk area and upon entering the roadway shall yield the rightofway to all vehicles approaching on the roadway 16   carrying article prohibited no person operating a bicycle shall carry any package bundle or article which prevents the rider from keeping at least one hand upon the handle bars 17   riding on sidewalks a no person shall ride a bicycle on a sidewalk except in accordance herewith b no person shall ride a bicycle upon a sidewalk within a business district c when signs are erected on any sidewalk or roadway prohibiting the riding of bicycles thereon by any person no person shall disobey the signs d whenever any person is riding a bicycle upon a sidewalk such person shall yield the rightofway to any pedestrian and shall give audible signal before overtaking and passing 18   towing it is unlawful for any person riding a bicycle to be towed or to tow any other vehicle upon the streets of the city 19   following fire trucks no person riding a bicycle shall follow a fire truck or other fire equipment at any time 110   improper riding no person shall ride a bicycle in an irregular or reckless manner such as zigzagging stunting speeding or otherwise so as to disregard the safety of the operation or others 111   unlawful use upon tennis courts no person shall ride a bicycle upon any tennis court  part 1995   temporary seizure of bicycle in the event a police officer has determined that an individual has violated any section of this article said officer shall have the option in lieu of issuing a citation of temporarily seizing the bicycle being operated by the individual committing the offense for a period of up to fourteen days if the individual who is violating a section of this article has committed any previous offense of any section of this chapter within the preceding three hundred sixtyfive days the officer shall have the option to temporarily seize the bicycle for up to thirty days at the end of the appropriate number of days the owner of the bicycle shall be able to pick up the bicycle at the algona police department the police shall have the ability to temporarily seize the bicycle being ridden by the violator even if the bicycle does not belong to the person committing the violation if the person accused of violating a section of this article desires to contest the temporary seizure of the bicycle that person shall file an application for hearing within five days after the bicycle was temporarily seized with the kossuth county clerk of court magistrates division at the kossuth county courthouse a hearing shall then be set as soon as practical by the magistrate and shall be tried to the magistrate  part 1995 skateboards scooters roller skates and roller blades   unlawful use upon designated sidewalks a no person shall roller skate roller blade or ride a skateboard or scooter upon a sidewalk located in the following areas 1 either side of state street from jones street to hall street  2 either side of harlan street from the alley between nebraska street and state street north to the alley between state street and call street  3 either side of moore street from the alley between nebraska street and state street north to the alley between state street and call street  4 either side of dodge street from the alley between nebraska street and state street north to the alley between state street and call street  and 5 either side of thorington street from the alley between nebraska street and state street north to the alley between state street and call street b when signs are erected on any sidewalk prohibiting roller skating roller blading or the riding of skateboards or scooters thereon by any person no person shall disobey the signs c whenever any person is roller skating roller blading or riding a skateboard or scooter upon any sidewalk such person shall yield the rightofway to any pedestrian and shall give an audible signal before overtaking and passing  part 1995   towing it is unlawful for any person who is roller skating roller blading riding a skateboard or riding a scooter to be towed or to tow any other person upon the streets of the city  part 1995   following fire trucks no person who is roller skating roller blading riding a skateboard or riding a scooter shall follow a fire truck or other fire equipment at any time  part 1995   improper riding no person shall roller skate roller blade ride a skateboard or ride a scooter in an irregular or reckless manner such as zigzagging stunting traveling at an excessive speed or acting in any other manner so as to disregard the safety of the operation or others  part 1995   unlawful use upon tennis courts no person shall roller skate roller blade or ride a skateboard or scooter upon any tennis court  part 1995   temporary seizure of skateboards scooters roller skates andor roller blades in the event a police officer has determined that an individual has violated any section of this article said officer shall have the option in lieu of issuing a citation of temporarily seizing the skateboard scooter roller skates andor roller blades being used by the individual committing the offense for a period of up to fourteen days if the individual who is violating a section of this article has committed any previous offense of any section of this chapter within the preceding three hundred sixtyfive days the officer shall have the option to temporarily seize the skateboard scooter roller skates andor roller blades for up to thirty days at the end of the appropriate number of days the owner of the skateboard scooter roller skates andor roller blades shall be able to pick up the skateboard scooter roller skates andor roller blades at the algona police department the police shall have the ability to temporarily seize the skateboard scooter roller skates andor roller blades being ridden by the violator even if the skateboard scooter roller skates andor roller blades do not belong to the person committing the violation if the person accused of violating a section of this article desires to contest the temporary seizure of the skateboard scooter roller skates andor roller blades that person shall file an application for hearing within five days after the skateboard scooter roller skates andor roller blades were temporarily seized with the kossuth county clerk of court magistrates division at the kossuth county courthouse a hearing shall then be set as soon as practical by the magistrate and shall be tried to the magistrate  part 1995 snowmobiles   snowmobile defined snowmobile means a motorized vehicle weighing less than one thousand pounds which uses sledtype runners or skis endless belttype tread or any combination of runners skis or tread and is designed for travel on snow or ice  2003   manner of operationgeneral requirements no person shall operate a snowmobile in the city except as hereafter provided 1603 part   observance of traffic regulations mandatory snowmobile operators shall observe all state and local trafficcontrol regulations and devices 16033   registrationdisplay required no snowmobile shall be operated in the city unless registered pursuant to state law and unless the identifying number set forth in the registration is displayed on each side of the snowmobile 16031   standard equipment regulations all snowmobiles shall be equipped with muffling devices brakes lights and other equipment required by state law or regulation mufflers shall be properly attached and reduce the noise of operation of the vehicle to the minimum noise necessary for operating the vehicle and no person shall use a muffler cutout bypass or similar device on the vehicle 16032   lights no person shall operate a snowmobile without a lighted headlight and taillight when required for safety 16037   flag required no snowmobile shall be operated upon a street without displaying a flag with an area of not less than six by nine inches of flourescent orange color on a staff holder to put such flag at least five feet above the surface of the street 16039   dead man throttle no snowmobile shall be operated within the city unless equipped with a dead man throttle which when pressure is removed from the accelerator or throttle causes the engine to be disengaged from the drive mechanism 160315   careless operation unlawful no person shall operate a snowmobile in a careless reckless or negligent manner so as to endanger the person or property of another or to cause injury or damage thereto 16035   speed limitations snowmobiles shall not be operated on streets at a speed in excess of that posted nor at any time at a rate of speed greater than reasonable and proper under all existing circumstances 16034   yield required all snowmobiles while operating upon public streets shall upon approaching any intersection yield to all other traffic which is within the intersection or approaching so closely as to constitute a hazard 160318   leaving unattended unlawful no operator or owner shall leave or allow a snowmobile to be or remain unattended on public property while the motor is running or with keys in the ignition switch 16038   disturbing the peace in a manner so as to create loud unnecessary or unusual noise so as to disturb or interfere with the peace and quiet of other persons 160317   crossing prohibited streets or highwaysauthorized when a snowmobile may make a direct crossing of a prohibited street or highway provided a the crossing is made at an angle of approximately ninety degrees to the direction of the street or highway and at a place where no obstruction prevents a quick and safe crossing  and b the snowmobile is brought to a complete stop before crossing the shoulder or main traveling way of the street or highway  c the driver yields the rightofway to all oncoming traffic which constitutes an immediate hazard 160310   operating under the influence no person shall operate a snowmobile while under the influence of intoxicating liquor or narcotics or habitforming drugs 16036   traveling single file required snowmobiles shall be driven in a single file manner in the proper lane of traffic as close to the curb or edge of roadway as is possible under existing conditions 160314   towing no item shall be towed by a snowmobile unless coupled to the snowmobile by a rigid tow bar 160316   operation by minors no person under sixteen years of age shall operate a snowmobile on or across a public street unless he has in his possession a valid safety certificate issued to him by the state conservation commission nor shall the owner or operator of any snowmobile having an engine rating of three cubic centimeters or more permit any person under twelve years of age to operate such a snowmobile at any time except when accompanied by a responsible person of at least eighteen years of age 160311   hours of operation limited no snowmobile shall be operated in the city between the hours of  am and seven am except for emergency situations or for loading and unloading from a transport trailer 160312   time restrictions regulating use snowmobiles shall not be operated upon city streets during the period from april 1st to september 30th of each year 160313   operation limitationsgeneral requirements the operators of snowmobiles shall observe the limitations set out in as to where snowmobiles may be operated 1602 part   operation limitationsunplowed streets snowmobiles may be operated upon streets which have not been plowed during the snow season 16021   operation limitationspublic ways designated snowmobiles may be operated on any other street within the city except the following designated streets a phillips street on phillips street from the city limits on the south to diagonal street  b state street on state street from phillips street to ridgley  c jones street on jones street from mcgregor street to the north corporate limits  d diagonal street on diagonal street from phillips to roan  e commercial street on commercial street from roan to main street  f main street on main street from mcgregor to highway 18  g mcgregor street on mcgregor street from east street to lowe street  h call street on call street from jones to ridgley  i nebraska street on nebraska street from jones to ridgley  j highway 18 on highway 18 from the city limits on the east to the city limits on the west  k highway 169 north on highway 169 north from highway 18 to the city limits on the north  2 3 4 1980 prior code  216022   operation limitationsparks and other recreation areas snowmobiles shall not be operated in any city park playground or upon any other publicly owned property except with the express permission of the governing body thereof 16023   trespassing on private property no snowmobile shall be operated upon private property without the express consent of the owner thereof 16024   operating on sidewalks and adjacent areas no snowmobiles shall be operated upon the public sidewalk nor shall they be operated upon that portion of the street located between the curbline and the sidewalk or property line commonly referred to as the parking except for purposes of crossing the same to a public street upon which operation is authorized by the chapter 16025   violationpenalty a snowmobile being operated in violation of this chapter may be impounded by the chief of police for a period to be determined by the chief but not to exceed seven days 1604 railroads   definitions for use in this chapter the following terms are defined a operator means any individual partnership corporation or other association that owns operates drives or controls a railroad train b railroad train means any steam electric or other motor driven engine and the cars if any coupled to the engine operated on rails but does not include interurbans and street cars 01   obstructing streets unlawfulexceptions a a railroad corporation or its employees shall not operate any train in such a manner as to prevent vehicular use of any highway street or alley for a period of time in excess of ten minutes except 1 comply with signals when necessary to comply with signals affecting the safety of the movement of trains  2 avoid striking when necessary to avoid striking any object or person on the track  3 disabled when the train is disabled  4 safety regulations when necessary to comply with governmental safety regulations including but not limited to speed ordinances and speed regulations b any officer or employee of a railroad corporation violating any provision of this section shall be guilty of a misdemeanor an employee shall not be guilty of such violation if his action was necessary to comply with the direct order or instructions of a railroad corporation or its supervisors such guilt shall then be with the railroad corporation 02   crossing maintenance required operators shall construct and maintain good sufficient and safe crossings over any street traversed by their rails 03 golf carts   manner of operationgeneral requirements no person shall operate a golf cart in the city except as hereinafter provided  part 2008   observance of traffic regulations mandatory golf cart operators shall observe all state and local traffic control regulations and devises  part 2008   permit required no golf cart shall be operated in the city unless a permit from the algona city clerk has been issued to the owner of said golf cart the permit received from the city must be with the golf cart whenever it is operated within the city the permit is good for the calendar year within which it is issued and shall be renewed annually the fee for said permit is twentyfive dollars per year prior to any initial or renewal permit being issued the golf cart shall be inspected by a person designated by the city to make sure said golf cart complies with the requirements of this chapter  part 2008   proof of liability insurance as part of the permit process the owner of the golf cart must provide proof of liability insurance before a permit will be issued the proof of insurance must be with the golf cart whenever said golf cart is in operation  part 2008   standard equipment regulations all golf carts shall be equipped with the following a brakes  b brake lights  c turn signals  d slow moving vehicle sign  e bicycle safety flag on a staff holder to put such flag at least five feet above the surface of the street  f any other safety equipment which may be required for golf carts by of the iowa  part 2008   operation regulations the following regulations apply to the operation of a golf cart within the city a any operator of a golf cart must have a valid drivers license and be eighteen years of age or older  b all riders in the golf cart must remain seated at all times  c no more than two people may ride in the front seat of a golf cart and no more than two people may ride in the backseat of a golf cart if said seat exists  part 2008   times of operation limited golf carts may be operated during the following times a from sunrise to sunset during the time of year when daylight savings time is in effect b golf carts are prohibited on streets during inclement weather  part 2008   sidewalks and adjacent areas no golf carts shall be operated upon the public sidewalk nor shall they be operated upon that portion of the street located between the curb line and the sidewalk or property line referred to as the parking except for purposes of crossing the same to a public street upon which operation is authorized by this chapter  part 2008   streets upon which golf carts may be operated golf carts may only be operated on streets with speed limits of twentyfive miles per hour or less regardless of the speed limit golf carts are prohibited from being operated on the following streets except to cross said streets a us highway 169  b us highway 18  c mcgregor street  d main street from commercial street to us highway 18  e commercial street from diagonal street to putnam street  f putnam street from commercial street to oak street  g oak street from putnam street to finn drive  h finn drive  i phillips street from state street to diagonal street  j diagonal street  k state street from jones street to hall street  l call street from jones street to phillips street  m norwood drive from us highway 169 to us highway 18  part 2008   careless operation unlawful no person shall operate a golf cart in a careless reckless or negligent manner so as to endanger the person or property of another or to cause injury or damage thereto  part 2008   operating under the influence no person shall operate a golf cart while under the influence of intoxicating liquor or narcotics or habit forming drugs  part 2008   towing no item shall be towed by a golf cart  part 2008   trespassing on private property no golf cart shall be operated upon private property without the express consent of the owner thereof  part 2008   operation limitationcemeteries no golf carts shall be operated on roadways or other areas in cemeteries located in the city  part 2008   community eventsexception the algona chief of police may grant exceptions and allow any type of golf cart to be used on any city street by community and civic organizations for community events  part 2008 allterrain vehicles and offroad utility vehicles   definitions for use in this chapter the following terms are defined 1 allterrain vehicle or atv as defined in of the iowa amended 2 offroad utility vehicle or orv as defined in of the iowa amended  10152018   manner of operationgeneral requirements no person shall operate an allterrain vehicle atv or offroad utility vehicle orv within the city in violation of the provisions of i of the iowa or rules established by the natural resource commission of the iowa department of natural resources governing their registration numbering equipment and manner of operation  or the provisions of this chapter hereinafter provided  10152018   registration required the owner of an atv or orv shall maintain a current iowa department of natural resources registration title county recorder the registration certification shall be kept in the vehicle or on the person of the operator of said atv or orv when in use and shall be provided to a law enforcement officer upon request the owner shall display the registration decal or nonresident user permit decal as specified in the iowa  10152018   registration exemption the registration requirements of this chapter shall not apply to an atv or orv operated for purposes as defined in of the iowa  10152018   liability insurance required the owner of the atv or orv shall maintain financial liability insurance coverage covering operation of said atv or orv within city limits  10152018   equipment all atvs and orvs shall be equipped with the following 1 brakes  2 brake lights  3 at least one mirror so located as to reflect to the operator a view to the rear of the vehicle of a distance of two hundred feet  4 proper working of all applicable safety equipment on the atv or orv including safety belts if said safety equipment was manufactured with the vehicle  5 suitable and effective muffling devices that comply with the sound level standards and testing procedures established by the society of automotive engineers under sae j1287 an atv or orv shall not be operated in a manner that emits noise in excess of ninetysix decibels as measured on the a scale of sae j1287  6 a lighted headlight when operated from sunset to sunrise and at such other times as conditions provide insufficient lighting to render clearly discernable persons and vehicles at a distance of five hundred feet ahead  7 a lighted taillight when operated from sunset to sunrise and at such other times as conditions provide insufficient lighting to render clearly discernable persons and vehicles at a distance of five hundred feet behind  8 any other safety equipment which may be required on atv or orv by of the iowa  10152018   operator regulations the following regulations shall apply to all operators of atv and orvs within the city 1 any operator of an atv or orv shall possess a valid drivers license and be at least eighteen years of age or older  2 any operator of an atv or orv must observe all state and city traffic laws and regulations to the same extent as any other motor vehicle when operating an atv or orv within the city limits  3 operators shall signal of intentions to turn right or left either by means of a hand and arm signal or by a mechanical or electrical direction signal device as specified in of the iowa  4 no person shall operate an atv or orv with more persons on the vehicle than the atv or orv was originally designed to carry  5 no person shall leave an atv or orv unattended on public property while the motor is running or the keys are in the ignition switch operators shall comply with all parking regulations in the city  10152018   location of operation 1 city streets atv and orvs are prohibited from being operated on the following streets except to make a direct crossing of said streets a us highway 169 including any portion of the rightofway  b us highway 18 including any portion of the rightofway 2 parking no atv or orv shall be operated upon that portion of a street rightofway between the curb or edge of street paving and the sidewalk referred to as the parking area except for the purpose of snow removal maintenance or landscaping activities of the abutting property or to park the atv or orv in compliance with all parking regulations of the city  3 sidewalks no atv or orv shall be operated on public sidewalks except for the purposes of snow removal other sidewalk maintenance gardening andor lawn work or the direct crossing of the sidewalk  4 city cemeteries no atv or orv shall be operated on roadways or other areas in cemeteries located in the city  5 city parks trails and other land owned by the city of algona no atv or orv shall operate on any public recreational bike or walking trail city park or other city owned property except for those areas designed to allow use of motor vehicles  6 private property no atv or orv shall be operated upon private property without the express consent of the owner thereof  10152018   community eventsexception the algona chief of police may grant exceptions and allow an atv or orv to be used on a city street or any other city property by community and civic organizations for community events  10152018   accident reports the operator of an atv or orv involved in an accident within the limits of this city shall file a report as and when required by the iowa and the city of algona  10152018 title 12  streets sidewalks and public places street names new street naming procedures new streets shall be assigned names in accordance with the following a extension of existing street streets added to the city that are natural extensions of existing streets shall be assigned the name of the existing street  b planning commission proposed street names shall be referred to the planning commission for review and recommendation  c street names except streets named as a part of a subdivision or platting procedure shall be named by ordinance    street name change procedures the council may by ordinance change the name of a street    recording street names following adoption of an ordinance naming or changing the name of a street the mayor and clerk shall certify and file a copy thereof with the county recorder and county auditor    official street name mapadopted streets within the city are named as shown on the official street name map which is adopted by reference and declared to be a part of this chapter the official street name map shall be identified by the signature of the mayor and bearing the seal of the city under the following words this is to certify that this is the official street name map referred to in the municipal algona iowa 1988    official street name mapamendments a if in accordance with the provisions of this chapter changes are made in street names such changes shall be entered on the official street name map promptly after the amendment has been approved by the governing body with an entry on the official street name map as follows on date  by official action of the city council the following changes were made in the official street name map brief description  which entry shall be signed by the mayor and attested by the clerk b no amendment to this chapter which involves naming or changing the name of a street shall become effective until after such change and entry has been made on the map  street vacations council authority to to vacate when in the judgment of the council it would be in the best interest of the city to vacate a street or alley or portion thereof they may do so in accordance with the provisions of this chapter    proposal review any proposal to vacate a street or alley shall be referred by the council to the planning commission for its study and recommendation prior to further consideration by the council the planning commission shall submit a written report including recommendations to the council within thirty days of the date the proposed vacation was referred to it    public hearingnotice the council shall cause to be published a notice of public hearing at which time the proposal to vacate shall be considered    approval criteria determinations no street or alley or portion thereof shall be vacated unless the council finds that a public use the street or alley proposed to be vacated is not needed for the use of the public and therefore its maintenance at public expense is no longer justified  b abutting property the proposed vacation will not deny owners of property abutting on the street or alley reasonable access to their property    approval by passage of resolution when in the judgment of the council it would be in the best interest of the city to dispose of a vacated street or alley or portion thereof they may do so by resolution following notice and hearing    disposal by gift limited the city may not dispose of a vacated street or alley or portion thereof by gift except to a governmental body for a public purpose    effect on existing vacations whereas the city has heretofore by ordinance vacated certain streets and alleys the action of the council in vacating the streets and alleys is ratified approved and confirmed    filing and indexing copies of all ordinances vacating streets or alleys are on file in the office of the clerk an index to such ordinances vacating streets or alleys shall be included and maintained    recordkeeping the clerk shall maintain a book in which shall be kept a record of the ordinances by which streets and alleys were vacated  street and sidewalk grades existing grades confirmed as official the grades of all streets alleys and sidewalks which have been heretofore established by ordinance are confirmed ratified and established as official grades    maintenance of records the clerk shall maintain a record of all established grades and furnish information concerning such grades upon request  street maintenance and use regulations removal of warning devices it is unlawful for a person to wilfully remove throw down destroy or carry away from any highway street alley avenue or bridge any lamp obstruction guard or other article or things or extinguish any lamp or other light erected or placed thereupon for the purpose of guarding or enclosing unsafe or dangerous places in such highway street alley avenue or bridge without the consent of the person in control thereof    obstructing or defacing streets it is unlawful for any person to obstruct deface or injure any public road in any manner    placing debris on streets it is unlawful for any person to throw or deposit on any street any glass bottle glass nails tacks wire cans trash garbage rubbish litter offal or any other debris or any other substance likely to injure any person animal or vehicle    injuring new pavement it is be unlawful for any person to wilfully injure new pavement in any street alley or sidewalk by wilfully driving walking or making marks on such pavement before it is ready for use    excavationspermit required no person shall dig excavate or in any manner disturb any street in the city unless such person shall first obtain a permit therefor as hereinafter provided or as provided in other sections of this code a application before such permit shall be granted the person shall file with the clerk a written application the application shall give an exact description of the property by lot and street number in front of or along which it is desired to excavate state the purpose and for whom and by whom the excavation is to be made and who will be responsible for the refilling of said ditch and restoration of the street surface b backfill that portion of any excavation lying within the travelled roadway shall be backfilled with gravel and all excess material promptly removed c fee there shall be an excavation permit fee payable by the applicant in the amount as established by resolution of the council in the event such fee is not paid by the applicant the clerk shall certify such delinquent fee to the county auditor for assessment against the property described in the application for collection in the manner of other taxes    dumping snow it is unlawful for any person to throw push or place or cause to be thrown pushed or placed any ice or snow from private property sidewalks or driveways onto the traveled way of streets  except where in the cleaning of large commercial drives in the business district it is absolutely necessary to move the snow onto the streets temporarily such accumulation shall be removed promptly by the property owner or the owners agent and only after first making arrangements for such prompt removal of the accumulation at the owners cost within a reasonably short period of time it is also unlawful for any person to throw push or place or cause to be thrown pushed or placed any ice or snow from private property sidewalks or driveways onto a neighbors street rightofway area located between the curb and sidewalk  2006   playing in streets it is unlawful for any person to coast sled skateboard or play games on streets or highways except in the areas blocked off by the chief of police for such purposes  1988 prior code  8   traveling on barricaded streets it is unlawful for any person to travel or operate any vehicle on any street or public way temporarily closed by barricades lights signs or flares placed thereon by the authority or permission of any city official police officer or member of the fire department    use of parking strips it is unlawful to temporarily or permanently park store or place any car truck vehicle junk or any other goods wares and merchandise of any kind upon any street parking without permission of the council    use of streets for business purposes it is unlawful to park store or place any machinery or any other goods wares and merchandise of any kind upon any street for the purpose of storage exhibition sale or offering same for sale without first obtaining written permission from the director of public works  1987 prior code  8   washing vehicles in streets it is unlawful for any person to use any public sidewalk or street for the purpose of washing or cleaning any automobile truck equipment or any vehicle of any kind when such work is done for hire or as a business this shall not be construed to prevent any person from washing or cleaning his own vehicle or equipment when it is lawfully parked in the street    burning in streets or adjacent areas no person shall burn any trash leaves rubbish or other combustible material in any curb and gutter or on any paved or surfaced street    yard waste on streets prohibited it is unlawful for any person to place or discharge or cause to be placed or discharged any yard waste onto the traveled way of streets yard waste means organic debris such as grass grass clippings leaves garden waste prunings weeds brush and tree branches  2008 sidewalk maintenance and use regulations definitions for use in this chapter the following terms are defined a established grade means that grade established by the city for the particular area in which a sidewalk is to be constructed b sidewalk means all permanent public walks in business residential or suburban areas 01   responsibility for maintenance it shall be the responsibility of the abutting property owners to maintain in a safe and hazard free condition any sidewalk outside the lot and property lines and inside the curblines or travelled portion of the public street 02   failure to maintainpersonal injuries if the abutting property owner does not maintain sidewalks as required and action is brought against the city for personal injuries alleged to have been caused by its negligence the city may notify in writing any person by whose negligence it claims the injury was caused the notice shall state the pendency of the action the name of the plaintiff the name and location of the court where the action is pending a brief statement of the alleged facts from which the cause arose that the city believes that the person notified is liable to it for any judgment rendered against the city and asking the person to appear and defend a judgment obtained in the suit is conclusive in any action by the city against any person so notified as to the existence of the defect or other cause of the injury or damage as to the liability of the city to the plaintiff in the first named action and as to the amount of the damage or injury the city may maintain an action against the person notified to recover the amount of the judgment together with all the expenses incurred by the city in the suit 03   failure to maintainrepair orders by city if the abutting property owner does not maintain sidewalks as required the council may serve notice on such owner by certified mail requiring him to repair replace or reconstruct sidewalks within a reasonable time and if such action is not completed within the time stated in the notice the council may require the work to be done and assess the costs against the abutting property for collection in the same manner as a property tax 04   sidewalk construction standards sidewalks repaired replaced or constructed shall meet the standards set forth in the statewide urban design and specifications for the state of iowa residential sidewalks shall be located with the inner edge edge nearest the abutting private property two feet from the property line unless the council shall establish a different distance due to circumstances 05  542009   removal of snow or ice it shall be the responsibility of the abutting property owners to remove all snow ice and accumulations whether from natural causes or otherwise promptly from sidewalks if a property owner does not remove such snow ice or accumulations within a reasonable time reasonable time deemed to be twentyfour hours after such snow ice or other accumulations have been deposited whether from natural causes or otherwise the city may do so and assess the costs against the property owner for collection in the same manner as a property tax  1985 prior code  8206   encroachmentscouncil approval required it is unlawful for a person to erect or maintain any stairs or steps to any building upon any part of any sidewalk without permission by resolution of the council 07   unlawful acts designated it is unlawful for a person to a stairs and railings construct or build a stairway or passageway to any cellar or basement by occupying any part of the sidewalk or to enclose any portion of a sidewalk with a railing without permission by resolution of the council  b openings keep open any cellar door grating or cover to any vault on any sidewalk except while in actual use with adequate guards to protect the public  c protect openings neglect to properly protect or barricade all openings on or within six feet of any sidewalk 08   fires it is unlawful for a person to make a fire of any kind on any sidewalk 09   fuel accumulations it is unlawful for a person to place or allow any fuel to remain upon any sidewalk 10   defacing it is unlawful for a person to scatter or place any paste paint or writing on any sidewalk 11   throwing debris and littering it is unlawful for a person to throw or deposit on any sidewalk any glass bottle glass nails tacks wire cans trash garbage rubbish litter offal or any other debris or any other substance likely to injure any person animal or vehicle 12   display of merchandise it is unlawful for a person to place upon or above any sidewalk any goods or merchandise for sale or for display in such a manner as to interfere with the free and uninterrupted passage of pedestrians on the sidewalk  in no case shall more than three feet of the sidewalk next to the building be occupied for such purposes 13   sales stands it is unlawful for a person to erect or keep any stand for the sale of fruit vegetables or other substances or commodities on any sidewalk without first obtaining a written permit from the council 14 trees footnotes  1  editors note  adopted  amended ch 1224 in its entirety with the exception of   and  which remain as codified by to read as herein set out former   pertained to simialr subject matter and derived from adopted in 1995  and prior code  66 general provisions   purpose the purpose of this chapter is to promote and protect the public health safety and general welfare by providing for the regulation of the planting maintenance and removal of trees shrubs and other plants within the city  part 1995   definitions for use in this chapter the following terms are defined large tree means a tree that may attain a height of fortyfive feet or more low growing tree means a tree that will maintain a maximum height of thirty feet or less park means all public parks having individual names parking means that part of the rightofway in the city not covered by sidewalk and lying between the lot line and the curbline  or on unpaved streets that part of the street avenue or highway lying between the lot line and that portion of the street usually traveled by vehicular traffic public works director means the public works director of the city or his or her designee the public works director shall have the following general powers and duties 1 to direct manage supervise and control all planting removal maintenance and protection of all trees and shrubs on public areas  2 to guard all trees and shrubs within the city to prevent the spread of disease or pests and to eliminate dangerous conditions that may affect the life health or safety of persons or property  3 such other powers and duties as are provided by state law andor city ordinance tree topping means the practice of cutting the main trunk of a tree to limit the height of the tree  part 1995   tree board a establishment there is hereby created and established a tree board for the city of algona which shall consist of five members citizens and residents of this city who shall be appointed by the council members of the board shall serve without compensation the term of the tree board shall be three years except that the term of two members appointed to the first board shall be only one year and the term for two members of the first board shall be for two years in the event that a vacancy shall occur during the term of any member his or her successor shall be appointed for the unexpired portion of the term the public works director and street superintendent will serve as exofficio members of the tree board b duties the tree board may develop and maintain a comprehensive plan for the management of the city including planning tree planting and maintenance programs for all public trees  5152017   permits no person shall plant or remove any tree on any street parking or municipalowned property without first filing an application and procuring a permit from the public works director who shall determine whether a permit will be issued the person receiving the permit shall follow the regulations set forth in this chapter  5152017   planting restrictions no tree shall be planted on any street or parking except in accordance with the following a alignment all trees hereafter planted in any street shall be planted in the parking at a point halfway between the sidewalk and curbline in the event no tree line has been established or the existing tree line is not halfway between the sidewalk and curbline the public works director shall determine the tree line or the place where the tree line shall be planted b location no tree shall be planted closer than five feet from the curbline or outer line of the sidewalk parkings must be at least ten feet in width for large tree plantings and at least eight feet wide for low growing trees all trees should have a spacing of at least thirty feet from other trees or a greater distance depending on the species no street tree shall be planted within thirty feet of the point where property lines intersect at the corner of street intersections no street tree shall be planted within ten linear feet of alleys driveways hydrants water curb boxes transformers poles telephone junction boxes or manholes no tree shall be planted under or within ten lateral feet of any overhead utility wire unless it is a low growing tree approved by the public works director no tree shall be planted within five lateral feet of any underground utility no tree shall be planted within twentyfive linear feet or the width of spread of the mature tree whichever is greater from street lights c prohibited trees no person shall hereinafter plant in any street or parking any fruitbearing trees coniferous trees or any tree of the kinds commonly known as black locust bolleana poplar boxelder catalpa cottonless cottonwoods cottonwood evergreen green ash mountain ash mulberry norway maple siberian chinese elm russian olive silver maple lombardy poplar tree of heaven weeping birch willow or white poplar d the public works director is hereby authorized to establish specific standards governing the planting selection of species support treatment of root systems trimming spraying removal filling of cavities and bracing for all trees and plant materials in on or within public places e minimum tree size all trees planted on any street or parking shall be at least six feet tall when planted  5152017   maintenance in the event a tree planted in the street or parking is not being properly cared for the city may perform work on the trees the owner or agent of the abutting property shall maintain trees on the abutting property that are overhanging the street or parking in such a manner so that all branches will be at least fifteen feet above the surface of the street and eight feet above the sidewalks if the abutting property owner fails to trim the trees as required in the preceding sentence the public works director may within a reasonable time initiate abatement procedures as outlined in of the algona municipal shall be unlawful as a normal practice for any person firm or city department to top any tree growing along the street or alley rightofway tree growing in a park or other tree growing on public property trees severely damaged by storms or other causes or certain trees under utility wires or other obstructions where other pruning practices are impractical shall be exempted from this article at the determination of the public works director  5152017   removal of trees the public works director shall remove upon approval of the tree board any tree on the streets of the city which interferes with the making of improvements or with travel thereon he shall additionally remove any trees on the parking or street not on private property which have become diseased or which constitute a danger to the public or which may otherwise be declared a nuisance  5152017   nuisance and abatement all trees planted in violation of or not maintained in strict compliance with the provisions of this chapter or that are dead diseased or dangerous are declared to constitute a public nuisance the public works director may within a reasonable time initiate abatement procedures as outlined in of the algona municipal  5152017   protection of trees no person shall intentionally damage cut carve attach any rope wire nails advertising posters or other contrivance to any tree  allow any gaseous liquid chemical or solid substance that is harmful to such trees to come in contact with them  or set fire or permit fire to burn when such fire or the heat will injure any portion of any tree  5152017   appeals any person who receives an order from the public works director and objects to all or a part thereof may within five days of receipt thereof notify the public works director and tree board in writing of the nature of the objection and request a hearing thereon the board at its next meeting shall review the facts and affirm modify or revoke the order within five days after such hearing the public works director shall notify the appellant of the boards decision appellant will then have an additional five days to notify the public works director in writing of an appeal of the boards decision to the city council the council at its next meeting shall review the facts and affirm modify or revoke the order within five days after such hearing the public works director shall notify the appellant of the final decision  5152017   enforcement the public works director is hereby charged with the responsibility for the enforcement of this chapter and may serve notice to any person in violation thereof or institute legal proceedings as may be required and the city attorney is hereby authorized to institute appropriate proceedings to that end  5152017   conflict resolution between tree and structures where sidewalk or curb damage due to tree roots occurs every effort shall be made to correct the problem without removing or damaging the tree the public works director shall be responsible for developing or approving corrective measures  5152017 barricades on streets permanent barricades permanent barricades shall be located at the following places a on east maple street halfway between north main street and north johnson street  part 1990   temporary barricades it is unlawful for any person to travel or operate any motorized vehicle on any street or public way temporarily closed by barricades this includes but is not limited to temporary barricades that are placed as follows a overmeyer drive temporary barricades shall be placed on overmeyer drive north of the swimming pool on days when the swimming pool is being used the portion of overmeyer drive which shall be barricaded begins at a point west of the intersection of south thorington and overmeyer drive then west to a point east of the intersection of the access street located west of the swimming pool and overmeyer drive this area shall be barricaded if the swimming pool is being used from one pm to nine pm daily beginning with the saturday before memorial day up to and including the saturday before labor day if the swimming pool is not being used on a particular day and the street is not barricaded then it shall not be unlawful to travel on that portion of overmeyer drive  part 1990   limitedaccess barricades it is unlawful for any person to travel or operate any motorized vehicle north of the barricade located on north garfield street the barricade shall be located five hundred twenty nine feet north of the center point of the intersection of pine street and north garfield street however access to north garfield street located north of the barricade shall be available to any property owner that uses said portion of north garfield street for an access to their property  1992 title 13  public services sewer service system general provisions   purpose the purpose of this chapter is to establish rules and regulations governing the treatment and disposal of sanitary sewage within the city in order to protect the public health safety and welfare    definitions for use in this chapter unless the context specifically indicates otherwise the following terms are defined 1 bod biochemical oxygen demand means the quantity of oxygen utilized in the biochemical oxidation of organic matter under standard laboratory procedure in five days at twenty degrees celsius expressed in milligrams per liter or parts per million 2 building drain means that part of the lowest horizontal piping of a drainage system which receives the discharge from soil waste and other drainage pipes inside the walls of the building and conveys it to the building sewer beginning five feet 15 meters outside the inner face of the building wall 3 building sewer means the extension from the building drain to the public sewer or other place of disposal 4 city means the city of algona iowa 5 combined sewer means a sewer receiving both surface runoff and sewage 6 contributor means any person responsible for the production of domestic commercial or industrial waste which is directly or indirectly discharged into the public sewer system 7 garbage means solid wastes from the domestic and commercial preparation cooking and dispensing of food and from the handling storage and sale of produce 8 industrial wastes means the liquid wastes from industrial manufacturing processes trade or business as distinct from sanitary sewage 9 inspector means the person duly authorized by the council to inspect and approve the installation of building sewers and their connections to the public sewer system  and to inspect such sewage as may be discharged therefrom 10 natural outlet means any outlet into a watercourse pond ditch lake or other body of surface or groundwater 11 ph means the logarithm of the reciprocal of the weight of hydrogen ions in grams per liter of solution 12 private sewer means a sanitary building drain and sewer privately owned and not directly controlled by public authority 13 properly shredded garbage means the wastes from the preparation cooking and dispensing of food that have been shredded to such a degree that all particles will be carried freely under the flow conditions normally prevailing in public sewers with no particle greater than onehalf inch 127 centimeters in any dimension 14 public sewer means a sewer in which all owners of abutting properties have equal rights and is controlled by public authority 15 sanitary sewage means sewage discharging from the sanitary conveniences of dwellings including apartment houses and hotels office buildings factories or institutions and free from storm surface water and industrial waste 16 sanitary sewer means a sewer which carries sewage and to which storm surface and groundwaters are not intentionally admitted 17 sewage means a combination of the watercarried wastes from residences business buildings institutions and industrial establishments together with such ground surface and stormwaters as may be present 18 sewage treatment plant means any arrangement of devices and structures used for treating sewage 19 sewage works or sewage system means all facilities for collecting pumping treating and disposing of sewage 20 sewer means a pipe or conduit for carrying sewage 21 sewer rental means any and all charges rates fees or rentals levied against and payable by contributors as consideration for the servicing of such contributors by the sewer system 22 slug means any discharge of water sewage or industrial waste which in concentration of any given constituent or in quantity of flow exceeds for any period of duration longer than fifteen minutes more than five times the average twentyfourhour concentration or flows during normal operation 23 storm drain or storm sewer means a sewer which carries storm and surface waters and drainage but excludes sewage and industrial wastes other than unpolluted cooling water 24 superintendent means the superintendent of public improvements of the city or his authorized deputy agent or representative 25 suspended solids means solids that either float on the surface of or are in suspension in water sewage or other liquids and which are removable by laboratory filtering 26 watercourse means a channel in which a flow of water occurs either continuously or intermittently    superintendentappointmentpowers and duties the superintendent of the city sewage system shall be appointed by the council and exercise the following powers and duties a operation and maintenance he shall operate and maintain the city sewage system  b inspection and tests he shall conduct necessary inspections and tests to assure compliance with the provisions of this chapter  c records he shall maintain a complete and accurate record of all sewers sewage connections and manholes constructed showing the location and grades thereof    administrationright of entry the superintendent and other duly authorized employees of the city bearing proper credentials and identification shall abide by all state and federal laws before entering the properties for the purpose of inspection observation measurement sampling and testing in accordance with the provisions of
